jobDescription: Meta is seeking an experienced Administrative Assistant to support executives at Meta. The person in this role will need to be a masterful problem-solver and an organizational force given complex calendaring and heavy travel planning. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have exceptional communication skills, and will be resourceful in building relationships across the larger Meta ecosystem.This position is full-time. Meta is seeking a skilled and highly motivated individual to join the Admin Specialist Program team as an Administrative Specialist Lead. This role will be responsible for managing a rapidly growing team of Admin Specialists. The core focus of this team is to provide high touch administrative support to executives across Meta. The day-to-day responsibilities of the team are primarily focused on administrative services including calendaring, travel and expenses. As the Lead for this group, you will be expected to monitor the bandwidth of your reports, act as an expert and source of knowledge for the team plus a point of escalation for Meta leaders and cross-functional partners. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated organizational capabilities, experience collaborating with cross-functional partners and have the ability to seamlessly juggle multiple priorities. This role also involves interacting with executive client groups and requires an ability to partner with internal teams across the business. A successful candidate will need to be comfortable executing in a fast-paced environment, be highly organized, have strong communication skills, and the ability to build and use data for reporting metrics. This role is full-time. workload and bandwidth, and enforce the ratio guidance and/or manage exceptions if necessary Maintain an understanding of team and individual performance and quality of service Develop and maintain program documentation and guidelines in partnership with Admin Specialist Managers Provide regular and frequent feedback and coaching to individual team members Manage the coverage process in support of the Admin Specialist Program team Partner with Admin Specialist Managers to address Admin Specialist Program escalations Monitor the pulse and morale of the Admin Specialist Program team members travel and expenses) and enforce with the team Provide Administrative coverage for Admin Specialists and their clients as needed Act as a subject-matter-expert in Administrative best practices, tools, and processes Serve as a power user of internal and external tools used by Admins (Outlook, Concur, etc.), and serve as a coach to others Stay on the pulse of Administrative community updates and maintain documentation shared with the team Minimum Qualifications: Experience leading or managing individuals or a small team Experience mentoring, growing, and developing individual contributors Experience managing bandwidth and balancing workloads of multiple individuals Experience handling critical client situations Preferred Qualifications: Experience leading or managing Administrative jobTitle: AI Research Scientist, Neuromotor Interfaces, ML & Signal Processing
jobDescription: Reality Labs at Meta is seeking AI Research Scientists with experience in machine learning and signal processing research to advance our pioneering work in neuromotor interfaces, which has grown out of the acquisition of CTRL-labs. We’re building a practical neural interface drawing on the rich neuromotor signals that can be measured non-invasively with single motor neuron resolution. This technology will become one of the main pillars for interaction with the virtual and augmented world. We are a multi-disciplinary team of researchers investigating the nature of human neuromotor signals (i.e., electromyography or EMG), developing novel signal processing and machine learning methods to infer a user’s intent, and creating novel interaction techniques and user experiences. Help us unleash human potential by removing the bottlenecks between user intent and action. EMG signals are similar in many ways to other neural signals and audio signals and can be analyzed using many of the same approaches. For example, the task of transcribing characters typed on a keyboard from wrist-based EMG is closely analogous to that of automatic speech recognition. We’re looking for people who want to shape the future of this technology and explore this exciting new territory with us. AI Research Scientist, Neuromotor Interfaces, ML & Signal Processing Responsibilities: Build cutting-edge machine learning and signal processing models (event detection, sequence-to-sequence, signal separation, time series regression, etc.) to advance neuromotor interface capabilities. Collaborate with engineering and Human-Computer Interactions (HCI) teams to deploy models that leverage fundamental scientific knowledge into new technology and user experiences. Use quantitative research methods to define, iterate upon and advance key areas of our research agenda. Develop research-grade code for deployment in research prototypes. Set technical direction for a project of 2-3 researchers and engineers. Minimum Qualifications: PhD in one of the following fields: deep learning, artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer science, robotics, computer vision, computational neuroscience, signal processing, speech and language technologies, or related fields. Research-oriented software engineering skills, including fluency with libraries for scientific computing (e.g. SciPy ecosystem) and machine learning (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Pandas). Proficiency with quantitative methods (mathematics, statistics) and experience learning new technical knowledge and skills rapidly. Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. Preferred Qualifications: 5+ years of experience working autonomously to design, execute, interpret, and present research studies. 2+ years of experience as technical lead for a project of 2-3 individuals. Experience bringing machine learning-based products from research to production. Experience with interdisciplinary and/or cross-cultural collaboration. Experience in the analysis and modeling of high dimensional time series, such as neural signals, multi-channel audio recordings, multi-modal/multi-sensor signals, robotic sensory signals, financial time series, video, or other sensor modalities. Experience with speech enhancement, speech recognition, speech synthesis, source separation, audio event detection and classification, audio scene recognition, microphone arrays, beamforming, or related topics. Experience with real-time signal processing and/or human-computer interaction. Experience with large scale cluster computing for machine learning modeling. Experience developing end-to-end ML pipelines, including: dataset preprocessing, model development and evaluation, and software integration. Experience in software engineering in industry. Experience with scientific communication tools (Jupyter, Matplotlib). Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Meta is seeking a high-performing Architect to join the Center of Excellence (CoE) team within the DEC Design pillar. In this role, you will provide Architectural subject matter expertise and leadership for Data Center designs and systems with the goal of deploying concepts quickly and at scale in a global environment. This position is full-time.The CoE team is comprised of in-house engineers and architects who focus on streamlining our Data Center design program to enable fast deployment by the site-specific design teams. We also focus on technical evaluation of new data center concepts and technologies as well as staying engaged with emerging industry trends and building codes. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our software operates. Building and operating reliable and efficient data centers is essential to support the growth of Meta. The DEC Design pillar collaborates with all key stakeholders to ensure engineering and design of our data centers incorporate considerations from micro-levels (servers and IT equipment design requirements) to macro-levels (mechanical cooling and power distribution options) to ensure maximum efficiency and reliability of our compute infrastructure.The ideal candidate will have strong independent work skills and a strong background in all aspects of Architecture for Data Center/Mission Critical environments on a global scale. A thorough understanding of interdependent disciplines, such as mechanical, electrical, structural, and civil is strongly desired. This person shall be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational skills, and be a self-starter that can excel with little direction. Architect, Design Change Responsibilities: Be the Architectural lead in the technical evaluation of first-of-kind concepts and prototypes for Data Center critical infrastructure systems Lead global change management and standardization of Architectural related efforts, programmatically Collaborate with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to define design criteria and standards at the program level Work with and direct efforts of consulting engineers, including authoring scopes of work, reviewing proposals, and supporting Business Reviews both Quarterly (QBRs) and Annually (ABRs) Review, edit, and contribute to design standards, specifications, owner requirements, lessons learned, etc. Support CoE team management in the development of project briefs, budgets, presentations, and complex business case analyses Travel (approximately 25%) to data center sites, material manufacturing plants or Meta offices as necessary for studies, audits, and/or team meetings and working sessions. Some international travel may be required Participate in incident Root Cause Analysis (RCA) on an as-needed/as-requested basis Participate and/or lead supply-chain de-risking initiatives, globally Support unique emergency situations in real-time on an as-needed/as-requested basis Act as discipline Technical Lead, globally, ensuring continuity between distributed Meta engineers within your discipline (sharing lessons learned, leading industry update discussions, preparing training material, etc.) Support onboarding of new people within discipline foster a culture of support and inclusion for new team members Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or related field Professional Engineer registration (AIA, PE, or equivalent in related field) 10+ years professional experience in Data Center/Mission Critical design, construction, commissioning, retrofitting, operations and maintenance Experience creating technical standards for use within a portfolio of facilities and design efforts Experience in industry standards, building codes and safety standards including IBC Experience with the building design and construction process, including commissioning Experience with Data Center/Mission Critical facility systems (i.e. Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Structural, Fire Alarm/Fire Protection, etc.) Experience with trouble shooting and problem solving complex problems Experience with architectural materials and systems specification and evaluation Experience providing solutions to complex projects under pressure Effective communications skills, fluent in English Experience with AutoCAD and/or Revit, MS office suite, and Bluebeam Preferred Qualifications: Master’s Degree in Architecture or related field 12+ years of Data Center/Mission Critical experience Experience with Architectural design and construction globally, including North America, EMEA and/or APAC Published research experience Experience with prefabricated systems and construction techniques Experience acting as owner or owner’s representative Sustainable design accreditation (LEED certification, or similar) Facebook is proud to be an Meta is seeking an ASIC Engineer, Architecture to join our Infrastructure organization. Our servers and data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. By holding this role, you will be an integral member of an ASIC team to build accelerators for some of our top workloads enabling our data centers to scale efficiently. You will have an opportunity to work with AI/ML and video codec experts in the company, help architect state-of-the art machine learning accelerators and video transcoders and contribute to modeling these accelerators. Come work and learn alongside our expert engineers to build “Green” data center accelerators. ASIC Engineer, Architecture Responsibilities: Work on advanced architecture, algorithms and models targeting either video compression or Machine Learning solutions Analyze and map data center workloads to ASIC architecture, as well as develop performance and functional models to validate the architecture Implement and analyze algorithms and enhanced architecture for the data center accelerators Implement various models needed for the validation of the accelerators Minimum Qualifications: Experience and knowledge of Computer Architecture concepts such as processor architecture, memory systems and on-chip interconnection networks Programming in C, C++ or related Object Oriented Programming Experience and knowledge in one of the following areas - machine learning architectures, Digital Signal Processing or video codecs Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred Qualifications: Master’s or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related areas Experience driving power and performance trade-offs Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is hiring ASIC Emulation Engineers within our Infrastructure organization. We are looking for individuals with experience in HW emulation and prototyping required to build System on Chip (SoC) and IP for data center applications. ASIC Engineer, Emulation Responsibilities: Develop emulation testbenches in System Verilog and/or C/C++. Deliver emulation and prototyping models from RTL on industry standard emulation and prototyping platforms. Build and execute emulation test plan to ensure quality of the models and assist pre-silicon validation. Drive emulation methodologies for HW verification and SW development. Develop emulation tools, workflows and infrastructure in collaboration with RTL, verification, validation and SW teams for productivity during debug, runtime, and data analysis of results from emulation runs. Bring-up and debug PCIe, DDR and generic SOC interfaces. Develop emulation validation components for validation efficiency in testing, debug and automation. Develop and drive improvements using the latest emulation technology from industry. Partner with vendors to debug issues and deploy new emulation capabilities. Minimum Qualifications: Track record of ‘first-pass success’ in ASIC where emulation is one of the key validation tools Experience with current emulation technologies and methods, including simulation acceleration, in-circuit emulation, speed bridges, virtual prototyping, hybrid methods Understanding of compilation and build flow with experience building images from scratch with necessary design modifications to adapt to emulation Experience managing multiple design releases and working with cross functional teams to support and debug customer issues Experience with EDA tools and scripting languages used to build tools and flows for complex emulation environments Experience interfacing with the design, verification, validation and software development teams and understand their needs from an emulation perspective Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with verification, SoCs or similar designs. Experience in architecting emulation systems for various design scales (IP blocks, SOC, multi-chip system) with an understanding of tradeoffs between performance and ease of debug. Experience with SystemVerilog and C++ to model RTL components and transactors. Experience with post-silicon bring-up, debug and reproducing issues on emulator. Experience with Palladium & Protium tools. Experience with Python and Tcl scripting languages. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Associate General Counsel, Global Privacy Incidents
jobDescription: The Global Legal Privacy Incident Management team is looking for an experienced, highly motivated Associate General Counsel for Meta on all privacy incidents (data breach). Working closely with the Privacy Incident Management team and other cross-functional partners, we direct, advise, and conduct investigations, conduct legal risk assessments, identify and assess regulatory and individual notification requirements, and coordinate and synchronize Meta's global response to privacy incidents. You will be joining the world’s leading data breach response program. This position requires business acumen, strong collaborative skills, excellent communication, and substantive knowledge of global privacy breach laws. This role also requires flexibility, adaptability, and comfort with working on numerous projects simultaneously, with varied stakeholders, often under high pressure with global visibility. You will be working on industry-leading and cutting-edge projects, ensuring commitment to privacy and managing our compliance with applicable privacy breach laws and regulations. A successful candidate is excited by taking on and leading complex privacy projects (especially breach response), thrives in a fast-paced environment and can seamlessly drive success working with multiple cross-functional stakeholders to accomplish bold things. You must also be a self-starter, able to identify issues early and drive to resolution independently. Associate General Counsel, Global Privacy Incidents Responsibilities: Maintain subject matter expertise in areas of privacy and data protection laws (including state and federal consumer protection and privacy laws, GDPR and other global privacy laws) and advise on the impact of the same on Meta's business Advise and assist engineering, privacy, and security teams in the conduct of investigations into suspected privacy incidents, including applicability of privacy/data breach laws and requirements to notify users and regulators Advise the development and management of Meta's (and its affiliates') terms and data policies across the full range of Meta's different products and advise investigations into potential breaches of such policies Advise business team clients, such as HR, communications, and research teams, on privacy requirements Support members of the legal, business, and policy teams on privacy-related legal matters, including areas related to partnerships, acquisitions, integrations, and other business development opportunities Drive high-profile and high-impact projects involving privacy analysis and compliance with stakeholders across Meta's business, policy, legal, communications, security, and other departments Assist in the development and conduct of general and role-specific privacy trainings across Meta Manage internal privacy compliance programs and processes to ensure we meet our obligations Minimum Qualifications: J.D. degree (or foreign equivalent) and membership in at least one US state bar 8+ years of legal experience, including at a law firm and/or in-house experience with applicable privacy, compliance, litigation, regulatory, or product counseling Experience using business judgment and client counseling experience Experience advancing projects in a multi-stakeholder environment Preferred Qualifications: Experience conducting internal and regulatory investigations, especially data security investigations Experience with global privacy laws, regulations, and industry guidelines (e.g., US, GDPR, LGPD, etc.) Experience working with social media, ad tech and Internet companies Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Meta seeks a highly motivated attorney who is enthusiastic about technology and its potential for positive impact in people's lives to join Meta’s Product Legal group to support the Business Messaging organization. The Business Messaging team’s mission is to make business messaging the primary way people and businesses communicate. The position will require significant cross-functional collaboration with product, privacy, commercial and business teams. The ideal candidate is comfortable with and responsive to rapid developments and changes in direction as well as working with technologies, products and in practice areas without much precedence. This is an opportunity to join a growing legal team and to work on novel issues in an exciting, fast-paced environment. Associate General Counsel, Product (Business Messaging) Responsibilities: Review and advise on global product marketing and sales programs and initiatives to provide legal risk mitigation strategies across multiple jurisdictions Lead and coordinate legal advice across complex and multifaceted legal issues such as data use and privacy, sales and marketing, competition, and other global legal frameworks Collaborate with and drive influence across legal and business team subject matter experts, and guide escalations to appropriate stakeholders in order to take strategic and informed risks to meet client needs Coordinate with policy, communications, product management, engineering, sales and other cross-functional teams on business strategy Minimum Qualifications: J.D. degree (or foreign equivalent) and active membership in at least one U.S. state bar 8+ years of legal experience as a practicing attorney, including at a law firm or in-house Experience with one of the following or related legal area: product or regulatory counseling, privacy, data protection, competition or marketing & sales Preferred Qualifications: Legal judgment and strategic thinking, along with experience working both independently and cross-functionally Experience building and scaling legal processes and operations Experience working on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, delivering practical advice under pressure and operating within ambiguity Experience taking on projects involving different subject matters and areas of law, developing expertise quickly, and working cross-functionally Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking an experienced Campus Construction Manager to join our Data Center Engineering & Construction (DEC) Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating, and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability, and capital conservation. The Design, Engineering and Construction (DEC) team thinks from chip to chiller (or electrical substation), determining configurations and ensuring maximum efficiency of our infrastructure. The DEC Delivery team is committed to continual optimization of the delivery process at each level. The DEC Delivery organization operates in a matrixed team structure and the Delivery Campus Construction Manager will have the campus-wide responsibility for New, Retrofit, & Connectivity construction project success including responsibility to establish and maintain GC and trade partner relationships, talent development, and partner relationship management with key cross functional operational partners (Facilities Operations, Edge Network Services and Facilities Engineering to name a few) at the site in a culture of collaboration, safety and quality unparalleled in the datacenter construction industry. The Delivery Campus Construction Manager is responsible for leading all construction activity on the assigned campus which can be a single, double, or triple data center region. Each construction project on campus ranges from approx $1M- $5B project sizes managing a team of up to 11 direct reports and leading a team of direct reports as well as matrixed Safety, QAQC and Project Controls (Cost + Schedule) professionals at site toward predictable outcomes. Campus Construction Manager Responsibilities: The Campus Construction Manager reports to the Geographical Construction Manager (aka the Geo) within the DEC Delivery pillar. Represent the Design, Engineering, & Construction (DEC) interests as the onsite leader for all new build, retrofits, and connectivity activities as well as provide accountability for work within this area of responsibility. Represent DEC in the onsite Circle of Leadership (COL) at each campus to effectively partner with Infra Data Centers (IDC) cross functional teams. Accountable for the management of the live environment retrofit work on campus. Accountable for the management of major vendor (General Contractor, Cabling Partner, Trade Partner, Consultants) relationship at the campus level to include GC personnel. Development and succession and feedback signal for continuous improvement. Accountable for the management of biweekly risk identification review process and provide reports (financial, schedule, Q/C). Accountable for the management of CapEx and OpEx budgets for the campus. Accountable for the management of warranty work program for existing data center buildings. Accountable to ensure proactive risk identification and mitigation for all new build, retrofit and cable infrastructure projects at a datacenter campus as defined by predictability in: Safety, Quality, Schedule, & Cost. Responsible for the management of onsite talent, both Full Time Employees (FTEs) and Contingent Workers (CWs). Inclusive of the recruitment, retention, and growth of onsite teams to support construction and network delivery. Responsible for ensuring the partnership of the teams with the vendors as well as in partnership with the matrixed reports in Safety, Quality, and Project Controls (aka Cost & Schedule). Responsible for the management of cross functional team for Owner Furnished Equipment (OFE) procurement and delivery process. Responsible for the management of knowledge capture (aka lessons learned) and transfer at the program and campus level to ensure continuous improvement and consistency of delivery. Partner with cross functional teams for the development of annual capital project budgets including the provision of requested ROM construction cost estimates. Partner with cross functional teams to finalize project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, cabling partner, trade partner and consultant scopes. 10% travel to headquarters and other data center campuses. Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or equivalent experience. 15+ years of experience in construction management and/or equivalent experience in fiber connectivity. Proven successful experience with ground-up, retrofit, and/or connectivity construction. Effective knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards including fire protection regulations. Highly skilled with negotiations, capital budget management, and contract management. Successful management experience of large construction teams inclusive of trade partner and/or general contractor management. Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of data center systems including mechanical, electrical, building management system, fire protection, and network connectivity. Working knowledge of CPM scheduling methodologies and schedule management. Working knowledge of CapEx, OpEx, and construction cost control strategies. Working knowledge of supply chain management including creative risk and mitigation strategies. Proven success in matrixed organization structures. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Development and succession and feedback signal for continuous improvement. Accountable for the management of biweekly risk identification review process and provide reports (financial, schedule, Q/C). Accountable for the management of CapEx and OpEx budgets for the campus. Accountable for the management of warranty work program for existing data center buildings. Accountable to ensure proactive risk identification and mitigation for all new build, retrofit and cable infrastructure projects at a datacenter campus as defined by predictability in: Safety, Quality, Schedule, & Cost. Responsible for the management of onsite talent, both Full Time Employees (FTEs) and Contingent Workers (CWs). Inclusive of the recruitment, retention, and growth of onsite teams to support construction and network delivery. Responsible for ensuring the partnership of the teams with the vendors as well as in partnership with the matrixed reports in Safety, Quality, and Project Controls (aka Cost & Schedule). Responsible for the management of cross functional team for Owner Furnished Equipment (OFE) procurement and delivery process. Responsible for the management of knowledge capture (aka lessons learned) and transfer at the program and campus level to ensure continuous improvement and consistency of delivery. Partner with cross functional teams for the development of annual capital project budgets including the provision of requested ROM construction cost estimates. Partner with cross functional teams to finalize project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, cabling partner, trade partner and consultant scopes. 10% travel to headquarters and other data center campuses. Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or equivalent experience. 15+ years of experience in construction management and/or equivalent experience in fiber connectivity. Proven successful experience with ground-up, retrofit, and/or connectivity construction. Effective knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards including fire protection regulations. Highly skilled with negotiations, capital budget management, and contract management. Successful management experience of large construction teams inclusive of trade partner and/or general contractor management. Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of data center systems including mechanical, electrical, building management system, fire protection, and network connectivity. Working knowledge of CPM scheduling methodologies and schedule management. Working knowledge of CapEx, OpEx, and construction cost control strategies. Working knowledge of supply chain management including creative risk and mitigation strategies. Proven success in matrixed organization structures. jobTitle: CFCI Strategy Supply Chain & Procurement Program Manager
jobDescription: Meta’s data centers are the foundation upon which our products serve our users. Building and operating our mission critical infrastructure the “right way” from break ground to go live is synonymous with ensuring capacity availability and capital conservatism. Architecting, constructing, operating and innovating the telecommunications and structured cabling infrastructure within our data centers is fundamental to ensuring high availability, the capacity to meet our extreme growth demands and obtaining the most robust and cost-effective online service in the world!The successful candidate will spearhead Contractor Furnished, Contractor Installed (CFCI) procurement strategies based on Meta’s global demand signal, ensuring supply chain readiness for predictable and reliable delivery of capacity. They will own the identification and qualification of new suppliers, building a bench of preferred suppliers that diversify and de-risk Meta’s deployment model. They will assess suppliers for new/expanding markets, leveraging a request for proposal process. They will inform decision making for supplier allocations by collaborating with cross-functional team members responsible for strategy and planning, supplier performance, preconstruction, and project delivery. This role is a full-time position supporting Global operations, with expected travel of ~15-20%. Managing stakeholders located across all regions and time zones is a significant challenge and is key to the success in this role. CFCI Strategy Supply Chain & Procurement Program Manager Responsibilities: Build supply chain resiliency by forecasting demand for Contractor Furnished Contractor Installed (CFCI) commodities and working with our Preferred Trade Partners (PTPs) to create strategies that de-risk supply chain market signals. Partner with Sourcing Operations Engineering (SOE) cross functional partners to leverage CFCI and OFCI demand volumes, strategies, and process. Spearhead early engagement with data center engineering, construction execution teams and external supplier partners. Develop criteria for and execute requests for qualifications (RFQ) and an owner due diligence program for critical CFCI suppliers and manufacturers. Develop criteria for and execute a request for proposal (RFP) program for suppliers and manufacturers which diversifies the global supply chain network and informs a broader business allocation model matrix. Negotiate preferred pricing agreements with qualified CFCI suppliers. Lead internal teams in the development of project charters that clearly define the problem statement, goals & objectives, scope, and impacted stakeholders. Actively interface with stakeholders, including: capacity planning teams, preconstruction managers, contract managers, General Contractors, and design/construction managers to produce required deliverables. Lead regular status updates meetings to share current program status with respective stakeholders. Maintaining a solid service approach. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in supply chain management, business administration, construction management, or an equivalent technical degree. 10+ years progressive responsibility in supply chain & procurement management, project/process/program management, go-to-market strategy or other relevant experience. Experience managing multi-group, multi-disciplinary development projects, hyper-scale data centers, live mission critical facilities or similar technical construction projects. Experience in supplier proposal negotiation, leveraging bid analysis and scorecards. Experience managing supplier relationships with knowledge of industry best practices, including: new product development, supply chain buffering, just-in-time delivery, demand signaling, and procurement expediting. Experience establishing team goals and meeting project objectives and deadlines in a fast paced environment. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite with a demonstrated capacity to learn and/or develop new (proprietary or licensed) systems. Preferred Qualifications: Masters in Business Administration (MBA) Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP) Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking a Connectivity Engineer to join the Design Engineering and Construction (DEC) team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our innovative services are delivered, and our rapidly scaling infrastructure operates. The team lights up Meta ’s global data centers, delivering the physical infrastructure that connects the world to the videos, feeds, and other information stored on Meta ’s server banks.The DEC Connectivity Engineer will provide site level support to ensure DEC telecommunication projects are being executed on schedule, within budget and at the level of quality specified. Connectivity Engineer will be the key point of contact for managing the full project life-cycle including project kick-off all the way through production turnover into operations. DEC Connectivity Engineer is highly collaborative with cross-functional partners at the Data Center Headquarters, our on-site contractor, and other data centers globally. Connectivity Engineer Responsibilities: Project Planning & Control - Create, maintain, and report on site project and program scope, schedules and milestones. Work closely with site project management team throughout the project lifecycle from the creation of project and program plans through project close out. Learnings - Continually review ongoing projects for efficiencies in schedule, budget, and opportunities to enable cross-functional partners to be successful. Document data points to assist with field coordination of projects. Support development of project management best practices and initiatives, coordinating SOPs/SIPs with vendors, and participating in global and regional standards. Coordinate lessons learned with the DEC Center of Excellence. Forecasting - Support project controls team with forecasting and budget efforts as required. Share current project status with upstream and downstream partners, ensuring crisp and complete handoffs between teams. Technical Reviews - Establish milestones for equipment purchase and track and report against these milestones Assist with the selection and review of a contractor to support the structured cabling work within a data center. Metrics - Report progress and risks on site projects and other initiatives to key stakeholders. Workflow - Work with installation partners to establish and track milestones. Conduct pre-project planning, project handoffs, and ensure design delivery and verification. Identify and respond to project risks and high-priority issues rapidly and effectively through effective action and appropriate escalation. Track and manage project change order requests. Vendor Field Management - Responsible for all connectivity activities within construction, projects on site including tracking and reporting actual progress related to schedule expectations. Set and communicate clear expectations together with the immediate site team, build key relationships with our installation partners and drive a best practice, safe working environment and execute to a vision of ‘right first time’. Quality Assurance - Perform physical inspections to ensure vendor work meets DEC quality standards throughout the lifecycle of the data center. Validate physical installs, test reports, build accuracy, material and local code compliance including constructability reviews on multiple design phases. Technical Field Lead - Technical lead for industry and Meta standards, responsible to lead product evaluation, design, and installation methods in the field including scope clarification, design and installation details as the owner of the Request for Information process. Technical Coordination - Develop solutions to in-field scope-gap or clash issues. Partner with DEC design and engineering teams to digitally support design reviews, BOM reviews, and as-built drawing validations. Communications & Cross functional team engagement - Liaise with construction partners to ensure deliverables are met during new builds and retrofits. Coordinate with logistics partners, vendors, and suppliers to ensure a smooth end to end flow of materials as needed. Work closely with the relevant teams to proactively communicate progress and project risks and initiatives to key stakeholders. Safety - Ensure that vendors adhere to safety obligations in accordance with local regulations and DEC Safety best practices. Lead with 'safety first', with open and transparent communication. Acknowledging good EHS practices. Minimum Qualifications: Experience providing solutions to construction related problems. Experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and MS Project. 5+ years’ experience in project and/or construction management. Experience engaging and guiding stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Quality Assurance and Quality Control, including progressive inspections and acceptance. Experience with outside plant cabling (OSP) deployments including OTDR/OLTS testing. Experience with Primavera 6. Experience managing IT or IP Network deployment projects in a mission critical environment requiring coordination across multiple disciplines for the delivery of a common goal. Experience with fiber optic testing at scale inclusive of complex troubleshooting. Experience reviewing and leading installations to design documents and specifications. Data center development and/or construction management experience. Experience in leading deployments of Network/Structure cabling infrastructure. Meta is looking for an analytical thinker with experience in policy, government, business operations, or law to join our Organic Content Policy team. The team’s mission is to create and communicate rules for our products that empower expression and foster a safe environment for people on Meta’s family of apps. As an Organic Content Policy team member, you will work closely with a number of other teams at Facebook and Instagram, including our Global Community Operations, Product, Legal, Communications, and Public Policy teams. You will play a key role in developing, applying, and communicating our Community Standards both internally and externally. You will also manage high-profile content escalations. At times, you will be expected to make difficult decisions, under pressure, about whether to allow or remove content. Many of these decisions will garner attention in the media and be the subject of intense debate in civil society and governments around the globe.The ideal candidate will be an execution-minded professional who can think strategically, adapt quickly, work independently, and rapidly earn credibility and trust within all levels of the organization. They will be able to critically analyze and communicate the costs and benefits of refinements to policies and their implementation. They should be passionate about the services we provide and the people that we serve. Given the demands of content-related escalations, the candidate will sometimes be expected to work irregular hours, including early mornings, late nights, or weekends. Content Policy Manager, Organic Content Responsibilities: Help craft and implement content policies that take into consideration the needs of a global community Collaborate with Policy, Product, Operations, Communications and External Stakeholders to drive policy improvements Act as a global escalation point of contact and manage internal communications for policy issues Help articulate policy philosophy, launches, and changes to relevant parties, including management, operations, and other internal and external stakeholders Build relationships with and understand the perspectives of partners on internal teams, such as Public Policy, Communications, Operations, Product, and Legal Minimum Qualifications: Experience communicating cross-functionally, particularly in the area of consensus-building and persuasion Communication skills and experience communicating via multiple mediums 6+ years experience in policy, government, project management, law, or operations Bachelor’s degree in the humanities/liberal arts or similar field Demonstrated analytical-thinking and problem-solving experience Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of Meta products and principles Experience in or with the technology industry Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta seeks a highly engaged and experienced team player for a lead role to join our Infrastructure Construction Management organization. As a Contract Manager, you will report to a lead Contracts Manager, and be accountable to deliver on a specific functional program within a larger regional team.The role will partner with Contracts Program leadership and all levels across the organization to gather and understand operational and financial information to maximize contract value and reduce risk to the owner. The candidate must be experienced in contract development, including scope, pricing, contract structure, legal and pricing negotiations, and incentives. In this role, you will have the opportunity to support ICM’s organization from a deal strategy and operational efficiency perspective. Success in the role requires a high degree of process orientation, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, original thinking to proactively identify new and different approaches to structuring deals, and ability to work across multiple functions as a trusted advisor.The successful candidate will manage and optimize a variety of Construction, Engineering and Professional Services Contracts and will draft, develop, review and negotiate on the owner's behalf. They will partner closely with cross-functional stakeholders and the Project Controls team to drive a cohesive and high impact contracts program. The responsibilities of this role include contract development, contract administration, collaboration with Legal, Finance, Construction Management and Project Controls. They will also work to find opportunities for processes improvement within the contract space, in order to drive consistency and efficiency across the organization, along with our cross-functional and external partners. In addition, the role will develop, negotiate and execute a multitude of contracts, as well as partner with Contracts Program leadership to recommend workforce strategy and development for pre-qualified contractors based on key performance indicators.Partnering with stakeholders located across all regions and time zones is a significant challenge and is key to the success of our projects. This position is a great fit for a strategic problem solver with demonstrated contracts management, program development, talent acquisition, leadership, and risk management expertise. The position requires daily engagement with internal and external partners to help drive time-sensitive requirements; therefore, the ideal person must communicate effectively to influence a broad range of leadership and team members. This is a great opportunity to join a growing construction team and work on exciting data center projects throughout the globe, in an exciting and fast-paced environment. If you want to make big contributions to a fast-growing, innovative, and highly engaged team; if you’re not content with the status quo, enjoy the challenge of engineering and construction, we encourage you to apply! Contracts Manager, Delivery Responsibilities: Support the overall construction contract management function, including development and implementation of contracts management tooling solutions, contracts playbooks, and deal-to-contract intake and review processes for their functional program Partner with Contracts team leadership and other business leaders to help navigate complex operations and spend initiatives with significant spend and risk drive cross-functional contracts risk and cost containment efforts Understand applicable deal-to-contract policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with policies, procedures and control frameworks Proactively work with partners to deliver on various activities including: Budget planning and financial commitment monitoring. Building contract templates and clause libraries. Contract review processes and procedures. Risk and supplier relationship management efforts Develop and maintain customer relationships to ensure positive and constructive interactions representing complex contracting issues to leadership Coordinate and drive resolution to key business issues with legal, risk management, corporate contracts and leadership Serve as the point of contact for contract inquiries for their functional program Provide guidance and internal support for their functional program on best ways to structure deals Ensure that signed contracts are complete and clearly communicated to all relevant parties, including interpretation to support implementation Examine existing policies and procedures to optimize the end-to-end process from creation of the quote to the completion of signatures with all parties concerned Share best practices with and provide training to team, peers, and outside business units to enhance the quality and efficiency of contracting processes Ensure all approved requests have been properly documented, escalated to the appropriate approval level, and resolved within SLA Act as a liaison, between Project Controls, Construction Managers and the general contractor to enforce contract Act as liaison between the Legal Department and internal business clients and external contacts Manage and coordinate various projects and contracts management responsibilities Partner with Contracts Program leadership to develop and define KPIs for the purposes of Quarterly and Annual Business Reviews Minimum Qualifications: Experience in all Microsoft Office applications (ex: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote) and Adobe Sign (or similar electronic signing tool). 5+ years of relevant work experience in strategic sourcing, contract negotiation, contract management and supply chain operations. Preferred Qualifications: Experience learning quickly in a fast-paced and evolving work environment Experience in adjusting to changing priorities and make decisions with limited information. Comfortable navigating ambiguity and championing change Familiarity in GMP contract delivery methods Solid commitment to contracts and records management efficiencies, with extensive experience across a broad spectrum of contract types, contract clauses, and business records Strong experience in communication and presentation skills with a proven track-record of high performance driving complex multi-stakeholder projects and programs Strong knowledge in process development and continuous improvement in contracts playbooks, deal-to-contract intake/pipelines, and other related procedures and tools Strong demonstration of commitment to delivering quality, attention to detail, and financial acuity Construction and/or data center experience Proficient in SAP, SRM, BW Reporting or equivalent Bachelor's degree or equivalent, with degree or graduate degree in Supply Chain Management, Accounting, Legal Studies (JD), Business Administration, English, Engineering, Construction Administration, or similar preferred Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking a data center Controls Subject Matter Expert to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. The Controls Subject Matter Expert will be a part of the facility operations team and will be responsible for reliability and quality of the Building Management System (BMS). The candidate will support data center daily operations, and global quality/standardization initiatives, and have a working knowledge of electrical and mechanical systems. control system malfunctions requiring extensive knowledge of a variety of electronic or digital controls systems and ability to test and modify in multiple languages of systems software Troubleshoot and repair controls hardware including controllers, relays, measurement devices, actuators, and associated equipment with mechanical and electrical device systems Review operating equipment data for efficiency improvements, monitor all building systems for abnormal operating trends, and make optimization adjustments accordingly Collaborate with other disciplines to make modifications to BMS settings to manage the building space Ensure appropriate cross-functional collaboration between local controls team and applicable local and global teams Manage controls vendors while supporting site In this role, you will be responsible for all facets of corporate and consolidated financial planning and analysis. You will gain invaluable experience with visibility into Meta’s business & operations and create impact within a growing Finance organization. You will be deeply involved with high-profile strategic and operational initiatives, deliver business analytics and insights, and make recommendations for short and long term decisions. You will contribute meaningfully to business planning and forecasting, including the development of annual operating budgets and multi-year plans and the evolution of our financial & business planning processes to support an increasingly complex ecosystem. You will also support ad hoc projects with opportunities for broad cross-functional interactions. Corporate FP&A Manager Responsibilities: Key contributor providing executives with clear insights into drivers of business growth, risks, and opportunities Contribute to forecast, budget and long range planning cycles, including enhancing Meta’s corporate model and coordinating with stakeholders on assumptions & inputs Gather, consolidate, and analyze operating and financial results for all three financial statements, including preparing internal and external reporting deliverables and analyzing and explaining trends & drivers Assist with management, Board business, and financial planning, including presentations and key analysis requests Serve as a key liaison and partner to cross-functional teams, including Finance, Accounting, IT, and other teams to drive scalable analyses and insights Assist with ad hoc strategic and operational projects as required Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree 12+ years of finance or financial planning and analysis experience Experience with financial statement analysis and a knowledge of corporate finance concepts Preferred Qualifications: Consolidation experience in a large company Detail-oriented and experience multi-tasking and shifting priorities quickly under pressure and tight deadlines Experience managing multiple workstreams end-to-end Experience with Hyperion Planning/Essbase or equivalent Comfortable with building models independently Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Facebook is seeking a data center Critical Facility Engineer to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our software operates to meet the demands of our customers. The Critical Facility Engineer will be a part of the Facility Operations team responsible for operating and maintaining critical systems in our data centers. The candidate will need to be experienced in diverse industries such as electrical generation, electrical distribution, cooling technologies and fire protection systems. Critical Facility Engineer Responsibilities: Perform hands-on operations and maintenance which includes all physical and administrative operations tasks, service, and maintenance in accordance with site processes and procedures to ensure the highest levels of uptime, efficiency, and safety without disruption to the business Complete work order requests accurately and on time Maintain a positive and professional working relationship with cross functional teams Respond quickly, using Facebook procedures or emergency operating procedures to data center facility emergencies Regularly inspect equipment, buildings, safety routes and grounds to check or identify any abnormal or unsafe conditions or faults Troubleshoot, evaluate and recommend system upgrades Order parts and supplies for maintenance and repairs Work with vendors and contractors to ensure work is in accordance with the agreed Facebook processes, procedures, and standards Escalate issues to facility management appropriately and timely Assist in scheduling and supervising vendors/subcontractors during equipment/systems maintenance and service Provides technical expertise and assistance as required Provides recommendation of improvements to the operations and maintenance program on an on-going basis Ability to work night shift work and set shift which may include nights and holidays Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent (i.e. GED) 5+ years experience in electrical, HVAC, mechanical, controls, or other technical maintenance field Associate's degree in engineering plus 3+ years experience or Bachelor's degree in related field plus 2+ years experience in electrical, HVAC, mechanical, or controls will be considered in lieu of 5+ years experience Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite - Word, Excel and Outlook Experience interpreting blueprints/CAD drawings Regularly walk job site areas of flat and uneven terrain Work at varying heights and from ladders Use hands and fingers Reach/push/pull with hands/arms/shoulders Stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl May lift and/or otherwise move 45 pounds or more Preferred Qualifications: 3+ years experience in a data center or other Critical Environment (pharma, clean room, medical, power production, etc.) Trade Certification or state license in Electrical or Mechanical (HVAC) Professional affiliations (7x24 Exchange, IFMA, Data Center Pulse, etc.) Knowledge of CMMS systems Knowledge of critical facilities operations Knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and life safety monitoring and control systems typically used in critical environments Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Meta is seeking a Data Center Capacity Planner to join the Strategic Planning and Analytics Team to drive capacity planning and turnup across our global fleet of data centers. In this role, you'll be part of the team that works cross functionally to develop the long range and tactical data center plans and scaling strategies for one of the most fast-growing infrastructure in the world. You will evaluate critical capacity planning changes and develop analytical and quantitative models that encompass demand and supply planning, and maintain the plan of record for Facebook's global data center program. You will support the technical analysis of new scaling initiatives and drive the implementation of new data center strategies and planning changes. Data Center Capacity Planner Responsibilities: Work with capacity engineering groups to evaluate demand signals and partner with local and field teams to develop corresponding data center supply plans. Work cross-functionally to define problem statement, collect data, build models and make recommendations. Build analytical models to support demand and supply planning, buffer management, investment and ROI decisions, and other qualitative data analysis on data center scaling strategies. Build performance dashboards and visualizations to highlight trends, and develop insights. Manage any requested changes to the plan and work with engineering groups in evaluating the capacity, cost, and timing impacts. Lead planning discussions and project reviews with key data center stakeholders such as networking, cabling, facilities, operations, and capacity engineering teams to align on new projects and ensure alignment on all aspects of data center planning. Work with the data center teams and various stakeholders to define, create and report on relevant metrics for measuring and monitoring the business and influencing decisions. Lead and support various strategy projects, as needed, in support of Facebook’s data center scaling plans. Use technical judgment to identify and drive new project evaluations, technology reviews, challenge proposals and build consensus. Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in capacity planning, demand and supply management ,production planning, operations planning. Experience with process improvement, systems development, and project management. Experience with data analysis and data modeling. Experience in data analytics. Experience in Excel and developing visualizations using Tableau. Experience with SQL, R, Python or other programming knowledge. Experience in communications across stakeholders and presenting to senior executives. Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced Degree in Engineering or a related technical discipline, including statistics, operations research, electrical engineering. Experience with data center technologies or operations. Infrastructure planning experience. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Data Center Facilities Engineering, Controls Engineer
jobDescription: Meta is seeking a Controls Engineer to become part of our Data Center Facilities Engineering team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly growing infrastructure efficiently operates and our innovative services are delivered. The Facilities Engineering team delivers proactive and responsive full-life-cycle engineering expertise to the teams who operate and support our expanding global fleet of data centers.Controls Engineers are involved in all aspects of data center operations, essential to ensuring effective sequenced system operations, monitoring feedback, and analysis. They provide direct support to our field teams for new construction, site specific projects, and global level programmatic efforts. The establishment of new regions in the US, Europe, and Asia are important next steps in the evolution of Meta's infrastructure expansion. Data Center Facilities Engineering, Controls Engineer Responsibilities: Lead technically complex controls engineering projects for the facilities infrastructure operations team. This includes working cross functionally with other technical organizations including design teams, construction, field operations, vendors and R&D. Engineering point of escalation for technically complex controls system issues that occur in our data centers. Troubleshoot and engineer enhancements and corrective actions for designs and implementation processes/methods. Conduct detailed analyses and audits of controls system utilization. Develop effective measurements and reports from Building Management System (BMS) and other monitoring systems to optimize performance and reliability. Evaluate systems to perform effective and efficient load management and capacity planning. Monitor, trend, and develop engineering metrics and statistical data for strategic planning. Review new and retrofit controls designs, commissioning plans, and critical operational procedures. Review controls "as-built" technical documentation and verify accuracy. Investigate actual site conditions and update records. Develop and generate specifications, RFPs, ROMs and SOWs for projects. Evaluate facility processes and industry best practices to drive efficiencies and effectiveness. Routinely report and present to peers, partners and leadership. Up to 30% travel to data center and vendor sites for engineering studies, on-site technical support, controls systems audits, startup testing, and full commissioning. Minimum Qualifications: 4+ years professional experience in data center engineering, mission critical design, construction, operations, maintenance or related industry. BS degree in Controls, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering, or related field. In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree, either 10+ years of professional experience or an Associates degree in Engineering (or related Technical School certification) plus 6+ years professional experience will be considered. Troubleshooting and analytical experience. Experience clearly communicating technical issues. Presentation, project management, and reporting skills. Experience with computer based mathematical analysis and data analysis. Experience driving complex projects under pressure. Experience working independently and as a member of a cross functional team. Applied controls experience in programming development, start-up, and commissioning of electrical monitoring systems, central plants, air handling units, and evaporative cooling/humidification systems. Working knowledge of mechanical, electrical and life safety systems associated with critical environments. Experience understanding and auditing blueprints/CAD drawings and controls diagrams. Knowledge navigating Building Management System programs. Preferred Qualifications: Professional experience in data center engineering, mission critical design, construction, operations, maintenance or related industry Cross-discipline knowledge of multiple critical facility systems Familiarity with industry software tools Organizational skills and experience beyond the field technician level in activities such as project management, project engineering, and operations management Experience with software programming languages such as Python, PHP, SQL Experience beyond field technician level such as project management, project engineering, and operations management IT/Networking Certification Professional Engineer (PE) registration or local equivalent Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Data Center Geo Capacity Lead Engineer
jobDescription: Meta is seeking an experienced leader with a deep technical background to support one of our key functions within Meta’s Data Center Site Operations team. The global Capacity function is present in every one of our data centers and is responsible for ensuring Meta and our suite of applications always have the computing and production infrastructure to reliably meet the ever-growing demand of more than 3 billion people actively engaged with Meta and our suite of applications. The Capacity team works with peer organizations and regional teams that deliver services to Site Operations such as network operations, project management, facilities/maintenance management, logistics and supply chain operations in order to successfully deliver and maintain data center capacity to support ongoing business growth.The goal of the Geo Capacity Lead Engineer is to drive extensive, sustainable growth of our compute and storage capabilities through operational efficiencies and high impact, strategic initiatives. We seek a subject matter expert who can continue to drive innovation in this space, spanning people, processes, operations, cost, reliability, global scale, tooling, and automation. We seek a leader who can quickly absorb and understand the technical challenges of subject matter experts, local Site leadership, and Capacity teams, in a rapidly evolving technical environment. The successful candidate will gain alignment across these geographically distributed Data Center operations teams and partner organizations, driving initiatives that deliver the most impact by prioritizing resources and focus areas. exceeds all operational targets Represent the needs and drive the priorities of the Capacity team within a geographical region in internal and broader infrastructure forums, as the technical expert in this space Build trusted relationships within the team, to understand the biggest challenges and opportunities, and to advocate effectively for the right initiatives With partner organizations, develop and drive a roadmap that scales Site Operations, delivering high impact advances in tooling, hardware, and workflow Work with Global teams to drive a singular operations strategy, goals, and priorities for the Capacity function within Site Operations Measure and benchmark the effectiveness of operational processes both internally and externally, setting performance targets and driving communication and alignment between data center teams and central support teams in strategy, prioritization, and decision-making Mentor and identify growth opportunities for the broader Capacity team Up to 30% travel required Minimum Qualifications: Proven track record of success in a relevant Senior Technical, Operations or Engineering role Aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving skills Facebook is seeking an experienced Field Logistics Analyst to focus on Data Center Field and Warehouse operations. Facebook is seeking a forward thinking experienced Engineer to join the Production Operations team within Data Center Operations. Our data centers, and the tens of thousands of servers installed in them, are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Facebook is at the leading edge of the global data center industry both in terms of how data centers are designed and operated. This person should enjoy working in a fast paced environment where adaptability and flexibility will be key to their success. We seek an IT professional with advanced hands-on technical skills in Networks, Server Hardware and Linux (ideally in a Data Center environment). Having extensive knowledge of managing servers and performing complex projects in a large-scale distributed data center environment is a core competency of this individual. The candidate should also have deep knowledge and experience in at least one of the following core areas: Networking, Project Management, Tool and Automation, Hardware and OS repair. Data Center Production Operations Engineer Responsibilities: Perform deep dives and analyze complex technical issues within the data center, ranging from automated tooling to hardware failures and network issues. Work as a technical lead with cross functional teams on large scale data center projects and initiatives. Provide cross data center support and identify potentially larger issues, displaying effective communication when something is identified. Work with internal hardware teams and vendors to help resolve complex technical issues, maintain high hardware quality levels and influence future design to ensure ease of serviceability. Understand/analyze issues and be able to update and develop scripts and smaller sets of software. Use data to drive maximum server fleet up-time and utilization rates, by understanding hardware failure rates and SLAs to customers. Identify trends and systemic issues in the fleet and drive resolution. Mentor team members to evaluate and identify better ways to resolve issues and define updates to tools and processes. Provide guidance and mentor technical leads and the go-to technical resource for management. Build cross functional relationships and have the ability to influence policies and procedures to improve global data center operations. Participate in an on-call rotation. Minimum Qualifications: Knowledge of Linux and hardware systems support in an Internet operations environment. Knowledge of the interdependencies of data center functions and technologies. Knowledge of out-of-band/lights-out server communication methods, such as IPMI and serial console. Experience managing multiple projects within the same time schedule. Knowledge of enterprise level networking and storage equipment installations. BS, BA or BEng in technical field or commensurate experience. Proven communication skills. Time and project management experience. 5+ years of infrastructure or related experience. Experience in modifying and developing in commonly used scripting or programming languages. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in a large-scale data center environment. Experience in providing technical guidance to external vendors. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Facebook is seeking a Data Center Production Operations Lead to lead and drive the local execution of standardized workflows, triage unexpected anomalies and identify opportunities to scale. This operations lead will work closely with the Production Operations manager to mentor and grow the local team of engineers, and communicate strategy, vision and feedback to the team and leadership. This technical expert is a resource for the team, a driven and motivated self-starter and able to work well with cross functional partner teams to improve processes. Data Center Production Operations Lead Responsibilities: Represent the site as a technical point of contact for incidents, escalations, retrofits, etc. Leading a team of data center engineers focused on returning healthy systems back into production for the Facebook family of applications. Ability to see the big picture from leadership and implement the vision through global standards and workflows at the local data center site. Mentoring and developing engineers and technicians such that they can run daily operations with minimal supervision. Supporting the onsite contract vendor by unblocking issues that affect the team. Collaborating with other teams in data center sites around the globe to evolve and optimize processes and approaches in a globally consistent way that allows Facebook to scale and grow effectively. Manage server upgrades, integration, automated OS provisioning process, rebuilds and other projects as required. Understand and debug network, hardware, and Linux OS related issues. Identify and support the creation of documentation for the global DC knowledge base. Implement process improvements and inform best practices in data center operations. Drive specifications for tooling and automation that facilitate deployment, monitoring, quality hardware diagnostics, automated remediation and decommissioning of server hardware at scale. Ensure operational excellence through key metric achievement and ongoing continuous improvement. Responsible for hiring and interviewing candidates to fill open positions and the planning of new employee onboarding processes. Minimum Qualifications: BS or BA in technical field or commensurate experience. Experience with Linux and hardware systems support in an Internet operations environment. Familiarity with Python, SQL and/or shell scripting knowledge. 2+ years of experience in large-scale data center hardware deployments and building scalable infrastructure. 2+ years of experience managing multiple projects within the same time schedule. Solid understanding of core components of data center infrastructure. Proven communication skills. Team Support/Leadership experience.
