jobTitle: Data Engineering Manager - Enterprise Finance Products
jobDescription: Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to help drive the direction of products that impact the lives of over 1 billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. We're looking for a leader in our Data Engineering team to work closely with Product Managers, Data Scientists and Software Engineers to support product launches and roadmaps by building the data architecture that informs and drives insight.In this role, you'll see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. You'll work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, work with one of the strongest data sets in the world, use cutting edge technology, and see your efforts affect products and people on a regular basis. The perfect candidate will have strong data infrastructure and data architecture skills, a proven track record of leading and scaling data engineering teams, strong operational skills to drive efficiency and speed, strong project management leadership, and a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively improve companies. Data Engineering Manager - Enterprise Finance Products Responsibilities: Proactively drive the vision for BI and Data Warehousing across a product vertical and define and execute on a plan to achieve that vision. Define the processes needed to achieve operational excellence in all areas, including project management and system reliability. Build a high-quality BI and Data Warehousing team and design the team to scale. Build cross-functional relationships with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Software Engineers to understand data needs and deliver on those needs. Manage data warehouse plans across a product vertical. Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models and data pipelines in production. Drive data quality across the product vertical and related business areas. Manage the delivery of high impact dashboards and data visualizations. Define and manage SLA’s for all data sets and processes running in production. Minimum Qualifications: Communication and leadership experience, with experience initiating and driving projects. 13+ years of experience in BI and Data Warehousing. Experience in SQL or similar languages. Data architecture experience. 2+ years of experience managing managers. Experience scaling and managing 10+ person teams. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Development experience in at least one object-oriented language (Python, Java, etc.). Project management experience. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in a consumer web or mobile company. Experience with data sets, Hadoop, and data visualization tools. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Meta’s Enterprise Products team is responsible for building integrated, scalable, and robust enterprise applications. We are currently looking for an experienced, insightful, forward-thinking leader with experience supporting a global team focused on ERP and other major third party commercial software packages. In this role, you play a key role in reimagining productivity by shipping transformative solutions that serve diverse aspects of the enterprise.In this role, you will drive the Business Application teams toward success by connecting commercial software applications and product strategy with desired outcomes. You will ensure continual improvement of our current enterprise application products within the portfolio while collaborating with product teams and business stakeholders from sales, marketing, supply chain, customer care, finance, facilities, and legal to deliver the solutions that support their respective goals and objectives. You will establish trusted relationships with vendors to ensure the highest level of support and influence their roadmaps. Director, Application Management Responsibilities: Lead Meta’s Business Applications organization in Enterprise Products, including the following application areas: Sales CRM (Salesforce), Marketing, Procurement, Supply Chain, Financials, Financial Planning, Facilities, and Legal. Managing a large global team of application managers in implementations, support and solution development on commercial software business applications and platforms. Responsible for enterprise application solutions, vision, and strategy. Collaboration with product managers, cross-functional teams, and business stakeholders in creating end-to-end innovative business solutions. Drive process and product metrics, adoption by optimizing application usage. Own application integrations with third party products and Meta internal systems. Responsible for Vendor product data security, access management and Audit compliance. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information systems, Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 10+ years of ERP Application experience. 10+ years of progressive leadership experience, and in a large high growth company with diverse business application areas (Supply Chain, Finance, Procurement, etc.). 5+ years experience working across business stakeholders, vendors, and cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver outcomes. 5+ years experience translating complex business requirements into staffing plans, roadmaps, and execution plans. 5+ years experience driving process rigor and outcomes by analyzing SLAs, defect trends, priority, severity and operational metrics. Preferred Qualifications: Vendor product certifications for SAP, Oracle or major suite of Business Applications. Domain certification - Industry Association or statutory certifications in Finance or Supply Chain. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Director of Finance, Infrastructure Ops Planning & Analytics
jobDescription: Meta is seeking a Director to lead our Infrastructure Biz Ops Capacity Planning and Analytics team. The Director will be responsible for partnering with Product and the Infrastructure organization, which builds and maintains scalable, efficient, and reliable network systems and hardware infrastructure for the company. The Director will serve as the key liaison between Finance and the server infrastructure organization and oversee issues related to capacity planning and analytics to ensure efficient allocation of Meta's multi-billion dollar infrastructure investments. Successful candidates will have a strong technical skillset, as well as business partnering experience — and enjoy the balance of both. You will be challenged every day to utilize deep knowledge of SQL and statistics to lead teams to solve complex problems in a scalable way, paired with knowledge of finance and accounting concepts. You will be responsible for translating complex data into meaningful interpretations and recommendations for your business partners. Director of Finance, Infrastructure Ops Planning & Analytics Responsibilities: Partner closely with Product Teams and their Finance partners to understand infrastructure needs relative to business objectives and goals, working to tie out infrastructure CapEx needs with long-term product investments (both headcount and OpEx). Develop a deep understanding of data tables and metrics for analyzing fleet resources and usage. Develop and evangelize unit economic and TCO models to help product teams and their Finance partners assess and stack rank their infrastructure investments. Own financial analyses of server fleet utilization by product area and organizational pillar to better understand opportunities for optimization or reprioritization. Work in concert with Product Groups, Product Finance, Capacity Engineering and Server Fleet Analytics teams to develop long term CapEx plans. Establish frameworks for Return-on-Investment analysis for various tranches of Meta capacity (compute, storage, training, inference etc.) to help inform capacity allocation decisions. Grow and develop a team of high performing professionals responsible for capacity planning and analytics. Minimum Qualifications: 15+ years experience in finance and/or business operations Experience in technical infrastructure (compute and storage) capacity planning Knowledge of SQL, Tableau, Oracle, and Excel Experience building cross-functional relationships and partnering with senior leadership of organizations Analytical skills to translate large amounts of data into useful information Communication skills to tailor messaging as required for audiences of varying level of seniority and technical expertise Experience navigating through ambiguity and unstructured problems Management experience building and leading teams Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is searching for an experienced leader to join the executive communications team leading product communications. This person will lead product communications for a C-level executive, working closely with executives to build and execute on a strategic plan to communicate about the value and relevance of the products and technologies we’re shipping today, and excitement about the value the metaverse will create for people in the future.The ideal candidate is someone who can oversee a broad range of product communications programs, leading a team of communications professionals and partnering closely with executives across Meta. This person will work alongside product communications teams that are responsible for our Family of Apps, and Reality Labs division. A passion for social products and technologies, as well as content creators and platforms, and the ability to move fast in fluid situations is key for this role. This individual must excel at working collaboratively with high-level executives and colleagues alike, understands the content and creator world, and consistently deliver high-quality work, even under severe time constraints. Director, Product Communications (Exec) Responsibilities: Serve as strategic communications advisor to C-level executive by helping lead communications campaigns, product launches and public engagements. Work collaboratively and cross functionally across product communications teams, creative teams, and other stakeholders in product and marketing to build and execute communications plans to support the C-level executive in leading product announcements. Manage proactive and reactive media cycles around product, corporate and policy communication topics surrounding an executive. Find and secure external speaking and thought leadership opportunities with traditional and non-traditional media. Oversee reporting and metrics that measure and track the results of communications campaigns and external engagements. Manage a small team. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in English, Communications or a related field. 12+ years of consumer technology communications experience. Experience working with C-level executives. Experience in product communications and managing product announcements, launches and campaigns. Experience working with multiple internal and external stakeholders, managing several projects at one time and under competing deadlines. Media relations skills and relationships with traditional and non-traditional media (tech and business influencers). Preferred Qualifications: Experience working in consumer technology Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. The Meta Product TPM community is pioneering technologies to bring people closer together and our organization shares in the responsibility of doing it at global scale. As a Director of Product Technical Program Management, you will be responsible for driving large scale cross-functional product initiatives, including defining the strategy and leading the execution across multiple teams at Meta. You will be supporting the growth and development of Technical Program Managers who are driving strategy and execution in product areas, such as Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, Central Product Platform, Commerce Platform, Integrity, and Privacy as well as product platform areas that have specialized technical expertise, such as machine learning, ranking, APIs, and scaled infrastructure. We are looking for experienced leaders who can lead teams in complex, multi-platform development efforts at consumer scale while maintaining clarity of product vision and organizational awareness. This posting represents different full-time roles across the company, including Facebook App, Instagram, Ads & Business Products, and other product areas. Director, Product Technical Program Management Responsibilities: Define and lead product execution strategy for multiple areas of products and platform. Build and lead a team of TPMs capable of scaling with Meta through a period of continued high-growth while forging tight partnerships with cross-functional leaders. Demonstrate an ability to structure an organization and optimize it for execution, including attracting top-tier talent and filing out gaps in the existing team quickly to accommodate growth. Manage from the front, prioritize, and drive the bigger mission forward by translating vision into results. Manage, mentor, and grow the existing product technical program management teams. Build and lead an organization with customer focus and effective communication with a focus on decisive, fast-moving solutions, quick and constructive resolutions to conflicts, and a “no barriers” mentality. Serve as an evangelist for the team and overall culture, both internally and externally. Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products. Understand Meta’s strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are recognized best in the industry. Minimum Qualifications: B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience. 15+ years of software industry experience, including systems engineering, hardware engineering, or technical product/program management experience. 10+ years of people management experience leading teams to deliver technical programs or products from inception to delivery. Experience communicating and representing work to senior leadership and framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience working with technical management teams to develop systems, solutions, and products. Analytical and problem-solving experience with large-scale systems. Experience establishing and leading teams through multi-disciplinary relationships, including product management and engineering to drive product impact. jobTitle: Electrical Engineer, Meta Data Center Design, New Builds
jobDescription: Meta is seeking an Electrical Design Engineer experienced in the design, construction and operations of critical facilities to become part of our data center engineering team, with a focus on New Build project delivery.Our data centers are the foundation upon which our software operates with efficient ease. Building and operating data centers the "right" way from the day they go live is synonymous with ensuring capacity availability and capital conservatism. The data center design engineering team approaches facility design from the chips on the server boards to the facility mechanical and electrical distribution systems which ensure and maximize efficiency of our compute infrastructure. Electrical Engineer, Meta Data Center Design, New Builds Responsibilities: Collaborate with internal stake-holders to define project design criteria, develop Basis of Design and lead internal technical scope reviews Technical leader managing consultants to implement the project through schematic design, design development, to construction documents Provide construction administrative support to the project manager during construction. Tasks include but not limited to, responding to RFI’s, issuance of technical bulletins, review submittals and shop-drawings, conducting source inspections at vendor factories and participating in the data center construction commissioning process Provide and analyze energy efficient solutions to minimize power losses Review and develop detailed scripts for change management request (CMR) activities Travel to data center sites for engineering studies, electrical systems audits, startup testing, and full commissioning, as required. Approximately 25% travel to both domestic and international project locations Provide electrical mission critical system review services to local data center operations teams Participate in equipment failure or power outage related incident Root-Cause-Analysis (RCA) Provide instructions to design consultants, installation contractors and validate the quality of installed works Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies Serve as Owner Engineer able to navigate competing priorities to effectively deliver capacity Minimum Qualifications: BS in Electrical Engineering, or related degree Electrical Professional Engineer registration, or working towards it Minimum of eight (8) years professional experience in electrical distribution design and construction Experience with high voltage (>115kV), medium voltage (35kV, 20kV 12kV) substation design, low voltage (480V/400V) power distribution, and UPS systems Experience with industry standards, building codes and safety standards including NFPA70, NFPA70E, IEC, BSEN, NSAI and IEEE Experience with construction and cost estimating processes Experience with electrical safety programs Experience with retrofits in operational facilities Experience with cross-discipline (i.e. Mechanical, Building Management Systems, Fire Alarm/Fire Protection, etc.) critical facility systems Experience with AutoCAD or Revit, Visio, Bluebeam, and SKM software Trouble-shooting and analytical skills Experience providing solutions to complex projects under pressure Preferred Qualifications: Electrical Professional Engineer registration PE/CEng Data center or mission critical design, construction and operations experience Experience on large scale electrical construction projects Project Management experience Experience in data center or mission critical design and construction support Experience with Electrical Power Management/SCADA systems Experience performing short circuit and arc flash studies IEEE PES or IEEE IAS Membership Strong communication skills Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Meta is seeking a data center Electrical Subject Matter Expert to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our systems operate to meet the demands of our customers. The Electrical Subject Matter Expert will need to have a broad understanding of electrical system and equipment function and will be responsible for procedure-based electrical maintenance, troubleshooting, repair, training, and project oversight. The candidate will need to be experienced in Low Voltage & Medium Voltage power distribution (High Voltage is a plus!), electrical protection & controls systems, UPS & battery systems, electrical testing, applicable electrical codes & standards, and have a basic understanding of mechanical systems. Electrical Subject Matter Expert Responsibilities: Serve as primary onsite technical resource of electrical infrastructure systems and equipment, with an emphasis on practical/field application Author or approve work procedures to cover electrical troubleshooting, repair, retrofit, and maintenance activities, with an emphasis on assessing & mitigating personnel and system risk Conduct or oversee hands-on troubleshooting, repair, retrofit, and maintenance of electrical equipment Provide Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QAQC) oversight of initial campus construction, retrofit projects & maintenance activity Lead and/or participate in root-cause analysis activities in area of expertise Provide training to Critical Facility Engineers and other cross functional teams on electrical equipment/systems, procedures, and changes Manage vendor relationships for electrical maintenance and retrofit work Provide feedback on global electrical maintenance strategies Provide feedback on global electrical system design improvements Other duties as required to support the operation of Facebook data centers Travel expectations: Can be significant during first 1-3 months for initial training/onboarding and then ongoing occasional travel for factory witness tests, collaboration, etc. Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or GED 7+ years relevant electrical industry experience or electrical trade level experience Bachelor’s degree in related field plus 3+ years relevant electrical industry experience will be considered in lieu of 7+ year relevant electrical industry experience Expansive theoretical & practical understanding of power equipment & systems, with expertise in electrical equipment design, maintenance, troubleshooting, testing, and/or construction Working knowledge of critical facility operations with experience or understanding of procedure-based work Working knowledge of mechanical, controls, and life safety monitoring systems Significant experience in comprehending electrical plans, specifications, and equipment shop drawings Experience working in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite - Word, Excel and Outlook Preferred Qualifications: 7+ years’ experience in a data center or other critical environment NETA or NICET electrical testing experience/certifications Equipment field service engineering experience Instrumentation & control, power system protection, power automation, etc. experience Experience in high Voltage (up to 345kV) equipment construction, operation, and maintenance Trade Certification or state license as an electrician Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta Reality Labs focuses on delivering Meta's vision through Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR). The compute performance and power efficiency requirements of Virtual and Augmented Reality require custom silicon. The Meta Silicon team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR and VR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture, to firmware, and algorithms.We are seeking Embedded Software Engineers to support development of ASICs custom-designed for Meta Reality Labs products. The successful candidate will be part of a team that includes algorithm, user experience, software, firmware and silicon experts. The ideal candidate will understand OS internals and low-level embedded software development for custom low-power SoCs. This is a full-time position. Embedded Software Engineer Responsibilities: Lead firmware design, architecture, and implementation for key components of Meta Reality Labs custom silicon SoCs Collaborate closely with silicon In this role, you will be a key contributor to Meta's Global Energy Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates to deliver our innovative services. Facebook is seeking an experienced, organized and self-motivated individual to support the development of cost-effective energy solutions for our growing fleet of data centers. In this role, you will be a key contributor to Facebook’s data center energy strategy, specifically supporting the energy infrastructure arrangements of our data centers through various stages of development including site selection, construction and operations. Your responsibilities will include: supporting the development of interconnection and energy supply agreements, monitoring progress towards key development milestones, developing processes and building and maintaining relationships with key internal and external partners. You will work with our Energy Managers and be expected to think critically about Facebook’s data center energy infrastructure. Energy Program Manager Responsibilities: Support the creation and execution of overarching and site-specific energy supply strategies for Facebook’s data centers Communicate energy requirements to internal and external stakeholders Negotiate energy infrastructure agreements Manage the day-to-day details related to project due diligence, site development, construction, commercial agreements, construction power agreements and operational issues Coordinate communication and deliverables between utility partners and internal stakeholders Build and maintain relationships with internal partners including site selection, strategic engineering, data center design, construction, facility operations, legal and finance Ability to travel domestically, as needed (up to 25%) Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a business, engineering, environmental, or energy related discipline 7+ years of relevant work experience with a utility, energy project developer, design/consulting firm, construction firm or energy intensive consumer Working knowledge of transmission, distribution and utility interconnection processes and electrical infrastructure Experience with project development and management for complex, large-scale projects Project management skills and experience managing multiple projects concurrently Communications skills, and experience developing and maintaining partnerships with suppliers and stakeholders Intermediate Excel, PowerPoint, and/or Keynote skills Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. The MRL team at Meta is helping more people around the world come together and connect through world-class AR and VR hardware and software. With global departments dedicated to research, computer vision, haptics, social interaction, and more, MRL is committed to driving the state of the art forward through relentless innovation. AR & VR’s potential to change the world is immense — and we’re just getting started.Our Core Tech team explores, develops, and delivers new cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundation of current and future virtual, mixed, and augmented reality products. From mixed reality and human interaction to natural inputs and beyond, Core Tech is focused on taking new technologies from early concept to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the human value and new experiences they open up.As an Engineering Manager in Core Tech you will lead, manage, inspire, and grow a diverse team responsible for ensuring we have outstanding calibration capabilities for all phases of research, design, engineering, and productization. You will collaborate deeply with experts across Meta including our partner teams responsible for delivering the Presence Platform (e.g. eye/face/hand/body/controller/position tracking) as well as our Product Design and Manufacturing teams to design calibration algorithms for next-generation VR/AR platforms. With your leadership, calibration will be a competitive advantage for Oculus and Meta. Engineering Manager, Calibration (MRL) Responsibilities: Lead, coach, and grow a diverse team responsible for calibration and world locked rendering architecture, algorithms, and software. Set clear expectations and create north-star aspirational goals. Develop a positive work environment based on accountability and impact. Tech leadership to develop, evaluate, understand, and implement cutting-edge calibration solutions. Design software which enables calibration (both factory and on-device), world locked rendering, and platform to algorithm validation across manufacturing facilities. Work with cross-functional partners to define robotic fixtures required for calibration. Collaborate across engineering disciplines and geographies. Recruit world-class talent and provide mentorship to team members. Minimum Qualifications: BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field. 5+ years professional experience architecting, developing, and shipping software products and/or services. 2+ years experience managing cross-functional engineering teams. Experience thriving in a dynamic environment where goals and requirements may be changing. Preferred Qualifications: Experience building calibration capabilities for integrated systems containing cameras, IMUs, lenses, and other components. Background in Computer Vision - SLAM/PT, 3D reconstruction, object detection. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Security at Meta is responsible for protecting our billions of users -- and thousands of employees -- every day. jobTitle: Engineering Program Manager, Strategic Engineering & Design
jobDescription: Facebook is seeking an Engineering Program Manager, Strategic Engineering & Design to become part of our team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly growing infrastructure operates, and our innovative services are delivered as we continue our mission to build community and bring the world closer together. The program enables the difficult design and decisions supporting the complex intersections of technical domains. Ultimately, this role focuses Facebook’s engineering expertise to bring complex technical and cross-functional problems from definition through design to produce executable engineering packages specific to the electrical, mechanical, and architectural detail of a building. This requires technical understanding of the building while also driving results with stakeholders across Infra. Finally, this person will be a motived self-starter taking charge of initiatives and be a forward thinker with a keen business sense. Engineering Program Manager, Strategic Engineering & Design Responsibilities: Manage cross-functional program design projects covering a range of technical domains (electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, data center construction, network, hardware systems, capacity management, etc.) through to completion. Drive complex problem statement development and create milestone schedules that end in decisions and implementation. Interface with Engineering, Facilities, Electrical/Mechanical Engineers, Construction, Network, Cabling, Security and business owners for project requirements and scope. Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, and testing phases. Digest technical drawings, questioning the inputs of the engineers across multiple highly technical engineering departments and helping to bring all of it together into a cohesive executable package. Manage dependencies and handoffs effectively and optimize schedules accordingly. Drive internal process improvements across multiple teams and functions. Conduct business process re-engineering reviews to innovate on business processes and define ways to improve their efficiency and effectiveness. Drive continual improvement of productivity. Identify areas of risk and drive solution with subject matter experts within the organization. Lead training and education programs for internal and external partners. Report and drive alignment and decisions from leadership across multiple organizations. Travel to datacenter sites as required. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience. Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, systems engineering, electrical engineering, construction engineering, or equivalent job experience. Large scale critical infrastructure, Research and Development, and/or data center experience. Experience building relationships and driving collaboration from cross-functional teams. 7+ years of experience in Technical Program Management/Project Management. Analytical, problem-solving, negotiation and organizational experience. Understanding of Engineering details and the impacts of change across multiple disciplines. Proven track record driving results on complex problems with many stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with managing projects related to data center design, hardware design and capacity management. Knowledge of design, construction, network, hardware, capacity management. Communication skills and demonstrated attention to detail. Interpersonal skills, including relationship building and collaboration within a diverse, cross-functional teams. Experience adapting and learning new skill sets quickly. Global design experience. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Job Info: Company: Meta, Reality Labs Position: Engineering Program Specialist (W-2 Contract) Location: Sunnyvale, CA (Hybrid) Summary: Meta Reality Labs Silicon Technical Program Management team is looking for a detail-oriented, high-energy Engineering Program Specialist (EPS) to assist our silicon validation teams with material management and distribution. The preferred candidate is a confident organizer who can prioritize issues, track details and never stop learning. You will be responsible for coordinating Silicon wafer builds with foundry partners, consolidating internal material requirements and communicating them with our vendor partners and collaborating with Meta’s sourcing, finance and procurement to ensure timely delivery of proto parts. This position will collaborate with multi-functional teams to provide engineering support for the development and validation of groundbreaking silicon material. Job Responsibilities: Management of silicon material builds for Engineering builds on New Product Introduction (NPI) products Track wafers as they flow from the foundry through to downstream teams Work with different engineering teams to provide sample forecasts Drive vendors to deliver the requested material in a timely manner. Ensure smooth flow of material vital to meet the requirements and schedules. materials and build matrix details Handle and rebound from critical issues that might stem from Engineering change (ECOs), material shortage or schedule slips. Report on material progress and investigate material blocker issues. Play a key role in the allocation of material in case of shortages. Act as the point of contact for with internal and external key stakeholders Host, attend and present at meetings with internal stakeholders and vendor partners Ensure PO deliverables are completed and invoices are paid on a timely basis Assist with lab equipment delivery and set up Top 3 Qualifications: Experience working with Hardware Engineering teams and builds for Engineering builds Experience creating and managing Bill of Material (BOM), Engineering Change Orders (ECO), and familiarity with navigation spreadsheets in MS Excel/Google Sheets Strong written/verbal communication Additional Qualifications: Experience managing, prioritizing and maintaining multiple projects at a time Detail oriented to ensure accuracy of all data, status and reports Excellent communication skills; both written and verbal Adept at working with multi-functional teams Top-notch critical thinking skill set; big picture program understanding and details Ability to react to changes in a time sensitive environment. Ability to work with overseas vendors across Europe and Asia time zones Ability to operate in high fast paced situations A Self-starter who can function with ambiguity

Meta is seeking a Facility Support Manager to join our Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our software operates to meet the demands of our customers. The Facility Support Manager leads and manages a team to provide essential support functions to the broader Facility Operations team on site. The ideal candidate will possess data center/corporate real-estate/hospitality experience with exposure to and awareness of critical operations or other similar environments (e.g.: hospital) or have experience as a third-party manager to critical operations.This position's main function is to ensure procedures and processes, maintenance planning overview, repair activities and environmental health and safety on site – including budget review and fiscal planning. Meta is seeking a data center Facility Technical Manager to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our software operates to meet the demands of our customers. The Facility Technical Manager will build and manage a team of Subject Matter Experts (electrical, mechanical, building controls, and project management), and will serve as the point of contact for stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be experienced in an array of diverse subjects, such as electrical generation, electrical distribution, mechanical cooling technologies, fire/life safety systems, and building automation controls. The responsibilities of this role include management of a technical team, coordination and prioritization of a wide range of projects and processes within the site, and communication of issues with various teams at the site. This position reports directly to the Data Center Campus Facility Manager. Facility Technical Manager Responsibilities: Lead a team of Subject Matter Experts (Mechanical, Electrical, Controls, and Project Management) at the Data Center to provide technical support to the Critical Operations Team Completion of all required safety training and conducting all work in accordance with Facebook safety policies Establishing challenging team goals to support the priorities and goals of the Facility Operations organization Set clear expectations and goals and give clear, actionable, and timely feedback Removing roadblocks and provide resources for the technical teams to support individual team member goals and recognizing people and teams for impactful contributions Show support and care for team members by finding opportunities to develop and grow based on areas of strength and interest Provide performance feedback and ratings for direct reports and eventual reports Monitoring Facilities systems to ensure operation within original design assumptions and performance Working with stakeholders to develop and implement operational improvement projects Providing oversight and ownership to the Construction Project Management process including all phases of the project lifecycle (intake, programming/scoping, design, pre-construction, funding, construction, close-out) Work with members across the organization to prioritize SME support Collaborating with other cross functional teams to investigate issues and develop solutions Provide leadership and support for investigating root cause on unplanned operational events Support Commissioning and Quality Assurance programs for construction and retrofit projects Work with recruiting to hire and interview and select candidates for open positions Occasional travel to Data Centers and vendors as required Minimum Qualifications: Experience communicating and presenting technical material effectively Proficient in using modern personal computer tools like Microsoft Office Suite - Word, Excel, and Outlook Proven time management, organization, and prioritization skills Knowledge and understanding of applicable regulatory codes and standards 10+ years of technical experience in Electrical, Mechanical, or Controls or a four-year technical degree such as engineering or technical program with 6+ years experience Technical knowledge and experience with Electrical Distribution, Emergency Generators, HVAC, Plumbing, Fire/Life Safety Protection Systems, Building Automation Systems, and Project Management Experience troubleshooting complex problems and addressing root causes by analyzing data Relevant experience in building, managing, and coordinating technical teams Experience planning and executing work effectively and with minimal input or supervision Preferred Qualifications: Experience in Data Center or other Critical Facilities strongly preferred 4+ years experience in managing technical teams Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Finance Director, Head of Server and Infrastructure Engineering
jobDescription: Meta is seeking a leader for the Server and Infra Engineering Finance Team within the Finance & Business Planning (FBP) organization. FBP’s mission is to enable Meta to plan, prioritize, and execute as effectively as possible. FBP brings an independent and objective perspective to the data and decisions that we support and always advocates for intellectual honesty. With a deep understanding of core drivers of technical infrastructure, you will be responsible for leading a team of finance professionals to perform core FP&A duties as well as applied analytical work around hardware price modeling, with a view to helping Infrastructure leadership make timely and well-informed decisions. Finance Director, Head of Server and Infrastructure Engineering Responsibilities: Lead and develop a team of finance professionals supporting Meta’s Servers and Infra Engineering groups Serve as the primary finance adviser to the Head of Server Infrastructure Manage FP&A activities for a growing business including budgeting, forecasting, and long-range planning across CapEx, OpEx and headcount Understand, impact, and influence business investment decisions and prioritization through detailed financial analysis Deep dive into critical capital Investments, COGS, HC requirements, and long term strategic implications of infrastructure agreements Provide insights to business partners through variance analysis, forecasting and budgeting processes Create strong business partnerships with various functions across the business, including capacity engineering, supply chain, hardware and infrastructure strategy Minimum Qualifications: 15+ years of experience in finance, strategy consulting, investment banking, or business operations, or finance Bachelor’s degree Experience developing analytical frameworks and communicating financial concepts to leadership Experience partnering with and influencing functional leaders Experience with building financial models in Excel Experience with PowerPoint, Oracle and Hyperion Experience in accounting concepts and financial planning Demonstrated experience communicating effectively with senior leadership Experience working independently and navigating ambiguity Preferred Qualifications: Experience managing capital expenditure and headcount planning in a technology company Experience managing multiple concurrent projects in a cross-functional environment Experience managing and developing a team for a future state Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. As a Firmware Engineering Manager at Reality Labs (RL), you will lead, manage, and inspire engineering teams developing platforms for Augmented Reality (AR).Firmware for AR systems spans multiple target classes, requires deep collaboration across engineering disciplines and the full software stack and directly impacts user immersion. You'll guide architecture and delivery of highly performant and reliable firmware across multiple platforms and product lines. The ideal candidate will have deep embedded system technical knowledge along with a focus on building top teams who deliver great consumer products focused on incredible customer experiences. Firmware Engineering Manager, Reality Labs Responsibilities: Build and lead teams to deliver firmware for world-class products. Integrate, customize, optimize firmware across all RL technology verticals. Collaborate across electrical, silicon, SW, user experience, and hardware teams to define and build embedded system architectures for AR hardware. Provide technical leadership and guidance to team members and project peers. Set clear expectations and create a positive work environment based on accountability, in collaboration with the engineering and management teams. Build tools and architectures to support technology experimentation across the company. Build development processes that allow for rapid development and experimentation while maintaining a high quality product. Understand and drive implementation of FW/SW development practices across teams and projects. Minimum Qualifications: MS or BS in Computer Science or Electrical/Electronics Engineering or equivalent. Working experience with using standard software development frameworks (Agile, Kanban, XP). Experience working with remote teams. 10+ years expertise in developing and shipping embedded solutions for consumer products. 5+ years of experience in directly managing and leading teams. Experience building an organization to scale across multiple products. Experience working with vendor provided solutions. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in protocol implementations such as USB device classes (UVC, UAC, HID). Experience in real-time processing for computer vision and user interaction tasks, high-compute/throughput systems and using simulation and modeling technique to estimate performance and power. Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices. Hands-on experience with FPGA and vendor specific hardware evaluation boards. Experience with Scaled Agile approaches to code development. Hands-on coding experience with peripherals such as USB, SPI, MIPI CSI/DSI, I2C, UART, GPIO etc. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. You will be joining the Center of Excellence (COE) team that supports FP&A for all of Meta. The COE team supports Core Products & Business Finance and New Platform & Infrastructure Finance pillars on core financial operations. The COE's Mission is to leverage scalable solutions to enable Meta FP&A to effectively centralize, standardize and optimize deliverables and processes to facilitate Meta's continued success. You will be responsible for most of the daily FP&A operations and provide direct support to all finance managers for a total team success. You need to have basic knowledge in finance and accounting operations. You need to be able to work collaboratively with all Finance and Business Planning (FBP) teams. You will be at the forefront of managing the day-to-day operations to help Finance scale to support the growing business for all of Meta. You will play a critical role in closing the books, and in headcount and OpEx management for Meta businesses. You will gain invaluable experience in a position which offers significant opportunity to build and scale FP&A processes and learn operational discipline. FP&A Center of Excellence Analyst Responsibilities: Responsible for the day-to-day operations to help Finance to scale. Own the monthly/quarterly close process. Prepare and submit accruals and reclass journal entries, perform actuals reconciliation with budget, own the variance analysis and review P&L daily during close periods to ensure financial data accuracy. Conduct headcount, operating expense, and capital expenditure reporting. Reconcile between reports and system outputs, ensuring 100% accuracy across all deliverables. Act as the primary finance reviewer for all PO and Contractor requests. Ensure all coding is accurate and funding within budget. Need to work closely with Procurement to ensure smooth procure-to-pay processes. Need to work closely with Business Partners to ensure correct coding and within budget. Primary POC to support Business Partner questions related to Financial Operations (POs, T&E, policy, etc.). Assist or own quarterly forecast cycles and annual budget planning. Set up templates and be responsible for Hyperion data loads. Meet regularly with FBP Finance Managers to understand work intake and to review work output. Collaborate with cross-functional teams - including Accounting, Enterprise Engineering, Source-to-Pay, and HR. Minimum Qualifications: 2+ years accounting or financial experience Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent field Detail-oriented and experience working closely with Accounting teams to ensure controls during close Experience working and problem solving independently, organizing workload and priorities, and completing tasks on time Experience with building financial models in Excel to automate reporting Experience with Financial Tools/Systems Preferred Qualifications: Proficient in SQL and Tableau CPA or MBA Experience in Oracle Financials and Hyperion Planning Experience building working relationships with Finance leadership/managers Experience learning new systems/tools and proactively look for opportunities to create operational efficiencies with existing processes Experience with Excel/Google Sheets, PPT/Google Slides Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Meta is seeking a Generator Subject Matter Expert to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our software operates to meet the demands of our customers. The Generator Specialist will be a part of the facility operations team and will be responsible for being the emergency generator system operations expert. The candidate will need to be experienced in all aspects of generator theory, operations and maintenance (electrical, mechanical and controls) and have a working knowledge of electrical distribution and general mechanical systems. Generator Specialist, Subject Matter Expert Responsibilities: Serve as technical/consultative resource for Emergency Generators and supporting equipment, with an emphasis on practical/field application Support troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance of emergency generators Assist in authoring processes and procedures Analyze data, develop metrics, and identify trends related to reliability. Contribute to generator maintenance and repair strategy based on data On-site lead for root cause analysis activities in area of expertise Provide training to critical facility engineers on emergency generators and supporting equipment Manage vendor relationships, scheduling, and work scope Supervise and validate vendor-performed activities (startup, commissioning, maintenance, etc.) Perform any additional services needed to meet the requirements of the facility in support of maintenance functions Travel to other data center regions will be required Other duties as required to support the operation of Facebook data centers Minimum Qualifications: Knowledge of power generation and transfer systems Knowledge of diesel fuel system components and fuel quality management Experience interpreting blueprints/CAD drawings Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite - Word, Excel and Outlook 6+ years of experience as a trade or manufacturer generator technician, or 6+ years of generator experience in critical operations High school diploma or equivalent Preferred Qualifications: 6+ years of experience in a data center or other critical environment (pharma, clean room, medical, power production, etc.) Experience managing vendor contracts Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking an experienced Geographical Construction Manager to join our Datacenter Engineering & Construction Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability and capital conservation. The Datacenter Engineering and Construction (DEC) team thinks from chip to chiller (or electrical substation), determining configurations and ensuring maximum efficiency of our compute infrastructure, and the DEC Program Delivery team is committed to continual optimization of the delivery process at each level. The DEC Delivery organization and its sub teams operate in a matrix team structure and the Geographical Construction Manager will have the Geographical responsibility for New and Retrofit Construction project success (to include all data cabling infrastructure), GC and trade partner geographical interfaces, team member development and relationship management with key cross functional operational partners (Facilities Operations, Edge Network Services and Facilities Engineering to name a few) of campuses within a Geography in a culture of collaboration, safety and quality unparalleled in the datacenter construction industry. The Geographical Construction Manager is responsible for $1 Million - $5 Billion project sizes managing a team of up to 6 direct reports, and 70 recursive reports, and leading a team of matrixed Safety, QAQC and Project Controls (Cost + Schedule) professionals within a Geography toward predictable outcomes. Geographical Construction Manager Responsibilities: Report to Meta Area Delivery Manager, ensure proactive risk mitigation and accountability for all new build, retrofit and cable infrastructure projects at datacenter campuses within a Geography as defined by predictability in: Safety, Quality, Schedule, Cost. Within broad organizational focus areas, set the strategic vision for site teams within a Geography and interface with a wide variety of internal and external teams to achieve cross-program goals. Ownership and accountability for Meta, Infra Data Centers and DEC values and ONETEAM culture of aligned partnership, teamwork and growth in a Geography. Maintain consistent visibility across multiple teams and provide input on important initiatives that help the larger organization evolve to achieve its vision statement. Coordinate multiple stakeholder requirements involved in the early turn over of phases within the program schedule. Ensure a productive and mutually beneficial owner/vendor relationship with the strategic vendors (General Contractors, Cabling Partners, Consultants, Trade Partners). Set and maintain clear expectations for the partnership and how we will work together. Manage, develop and recruit for (as needed) a core team of 5-11 full time staff per campus, supporting the delivery program. Contingent workforce staff planning and hiring is also a responsibility of this role. As a manager/leader, provide proactive feedback and performance management to ensure a high functioning team. Partner broadly with vendor partners critical to the program’s success to influence their strategy and execution in supporting ICMs mission. Provide structured feedback on their performance and partner to improve and optimize as needed. Negotiate construction contracts and change orders directly with the contractors and vendors. Proactively monitor project delivery updates, adherence to KPI’s and financial status. Role model/foster and encourage a high-performing, safety-focused culture across all teams, internal/external, involved in the program. Build trusted business relationships with all cross-functional teams to ensure positive and collaborative working relationships. Build robust communication channels and cultivate relationships to influence the strategy of partner organizations. Minimum Qualifications: Experience in Primavera P6, MS Project, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Quantity Surveying or equivalent technical degree and/or 18+ years of experience in project planning and construction management. Experience with the design and deployment of technical electrical and mechanical systems. Experience managing and developing direct employees, contractors, subcontractor and vendor relationships as well as experience working with standard practices in the design and construction industry. Experience working with local, state, domestic and international construction build codes and health & safety requirements. Experience with greenfield site development, ground-up and retrofit construction projects. Experience with a variety of construction contract delivery methods commonly used in the US and/or EMEA. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in matrixed organization structures Familiarity with retrofit projects in live data center or other mission critical buildings, including development of Methods of Procedure (MOPs) Experience in building and cultivating high performance teams Overall understanding of building systems including mechanical, electrical, data cabling, building management system, and fire protection in a datacenter environment Familiarity of network connectivity architecture and installation Datacenter development and construction experience Knowledge of Critical Path Method scheduling methodologies Procore software experience Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking an experienced and self-motivated Reliability Engineer to join our Global Asset Management team within Facility Operations. This person will work at the leading edge of Facility Operations to identify and manage asset reliability risks that could adversely affect data center operations. Managing stakeholders spread across time zones is a significant challenge and key to the success of our individual projects and overall asset management, quality and reliability program. Global Facility Operations Reliability Engineer Responsibilities: Support the asset care and maintenance strategies for critical assets based on Meta processes Support the development of standards, guidelines and processes to execute reliability program function Lead and facilitate asset criticality assessments, RCM studies, PM Optimization and other reliability studies Perform reliability analytics include Weibull distribution, Monte Carlo simulation and other reliability analysis Act as liaison between Reliability and other partner teams Support the development of standardized PM template to facilitate trending Works with appropriate technical teams to evaluate reliability and maintainability of data center equipment to significantly influence reliability and maintainability improvements Works with Asset Management and Quality teams to evaluate the failure data and other information and build that into a global reliability database Provides input for key documents such as reliability process playbooks, executive briefs/presentations and program metrics Define, design, develop, monitor, and refine an asset maintenance plan that includes both (a) value-added preventive maintenance tasks and (b) predictive and other non-destructive testing methods designed to identify and isolate inherent reliability issues Provide technical support to Operations, Maintenance management, and technical personnel Apply value analysis to repair/replace, repair/redesign, and make/buy decision Develop Reliability Improvement Process (RIP) reports on critical asset failures Develop or recommend engineering solutions to repetitive failures and all other problems that adversely affect plant operations Support Master Data and asset onboarding process Support the development and stewardship of maintenance strategies Support the spares development and sustainment program Work with Maintenance to analyze asset characteristics, including: asset availability, overall equipment effectiveness and remaining useful life Minimum Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in reliability engineering (related to electrical or mechanical cooling equipment) Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Electrical Reliability Engineering or similar technical discipline Certifications in Maintenance & Reliability such as CMRP, CRL, CRE Knowledgeable of relevant ISO standards (ISO 14224, ISO 17359, ISO 55000) Proficient in usage of EAM solutions to extract data and develop meaningful insights Experienced in Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) and Failure Maintenance Effect Analysis activities for maintenance/process/equipment design optimization to meet reliability requirements Preferred Qualifications: Proficient in developing and executing Design for Reliability Activities (Reliability prediction models, accelerated life testing, environmental stress testing, equipment qualification criteria, etc.) Experience in performing Reliability, Availability and Maintainability (RAM) models Experience with data center equipment such as critical cooling systems, generators, main switchboards, network gear Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Our Data Centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates to deliver our innovative services. Meta is seeking an experienced, collaborative and self-motivated Global Shutdown Planning Program Lead to join our Global Facility Operations Support team within Facility Operations.This person will develop and manage the processes by which major maintenance and retrofit work is performed in data center buildings across our fleet. Retrofit periods at Meta are cross-functional efforts involving multiple stakeholders, particularly because these events affect the ability of data center buildings to serve IT traffic. Retrofit events are planned at a global level across multiple data center regions over the life of the data centers and executed in short duration windows. A successful candidate for this role will need to be experienced in planning major shutdown/turnaround periods at data centers or mission-critical facilities. This position requires working across cross-functional teams with often conflicting needs, a strong technical understanding of Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) and Network retrofit requirements, strong program management experience, and exemplary leadership and communication skills. This position is full-time. Global Shutdown Planning Program Lead Responsibilities: Lead development of maintenance/modernization shutdown strategy for Facility Operations in conjunction with key business partners. Support appropriate capacity planning within the business while ensuring modernization and operational uptime across our fleet. Lead development of long-range plans for shutdown maintenance and retrofit activities across a global fleet of data centers in conjunction with key strategic planning partners. Represent Facility Operations as the technical expert to coordinate with multiple stakeholder groups with a focus to minimize impact on business needs. Provide technical expertise to evaluate justification and return on investment of retrofits and maintenance performed within shutdown periods and operational environments. Coordinate with teams leading various retrofit and maintenance projects to ensure efficient and integrated planning at the site and global level. Support the planning and execution of project portfolios within a limited and finite time frame. In collaboration with cross-functional data center teams, identify and support efficient planning of lifecycle maintenance activities, upgrades, retrofits, and other site and central MEP/Network projects that require equipment shutdowns, to minimize impact on redundancy and IT capacity. Develop, collect, and communicate leading and lagging key performance indicators for retrofit planning and execution workstreams - to site and IDC teams. Interface with responsible site teams to support project execution, closeout, and recommissioning activities. Support global process standardization and improvement through identification, creation, and participation in cross-functional projects and working groups. Drive cross-functional process development and improvement opportunities where required for retrofit activity. Leverage best practices and lessons learned to develop and improve scalable processes and tooling in support of retrofit planning. Represent retrofit planning in global forums. Coordinate with cross-functional counterparts and DC site teams to achieve an optimal plan for the business. Influence without authority in strategic discussions. In concert with other key shutdown planning partners, provide crisp and timely communications to leadership, site teams and cross-functional partners at DC sites and global teams, including decisions, risks, and progress reports. Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed (Approximately 25-50%). Minimum Qualifications: Experience with tools/applications for planning and scheduling projects and shutdown activities. Expert knowledge in process and program development. Track record of process improvement and providing requirements for tooling/applications in support of these processes. Track record of thinking strategically and executing tactically, producing results in timely manner. Experience leading programs with cross-functional stakeholders and implementation across a fleet or global enterprise. Experience making critical decisions and working with minimal direction. Technical knowledge of critical environments and large-scale retrofit and maintenance projects. 10+ years of experience managing maintenance and/or retrofits across diverse stakeholder groups in mission critical facilities. Preferred Qualifications: Capacity Planning experience. Formal project and/or program management training and experience. 10+ years of experience in project management during shutdowns in data centers. Bachelor's degree in a technical field. Advanced degree in engineering or construction management. Experience with retrofit and maintenance projects in data centers. Tableau/Data Analytics experience. Meta is looking for a driven, results-oriented Governance Manager to join our Governance team. The team's mission is to partner with colleagues across Meta to design, build, and manage new decision-making mechanisms and institutions to give people greater control over Facebook’s products and services. One of our flagship projects is the establishment and operation of an external Oversight Board to exercise independent judgment over some of Facebook’s and Instagram’s most difficult and significant content decisions. We are currently working to establish and expand our team’s capabilities to take a longer-term, strategic view of future trends and frame global intelligence for Global Affairs leadership. In this role, you will help establish and expand the intelligence unit of our team. You will be responsible for coordinating the drafting of bi-weekly intelligence briefings and identifying timely and insightful trends for Global Affairs leadership. In this role, you will help to identify challenges and opportunities the company may face in order to help inform leadership decision making. You will coordinate closely with internal teams and external experts to incorporate internal and external signals into intelligence briefings as well as ad hoc briefs. The ideal candidate will demonstrate flexibility, teamwork, and execution skills. The candidate should also have communication skills, enabling them to effectively communicate with Meta leadership, design and conduct presentations, and collaborate with key stakeholders internally and externally. Governance Manager, Future Trends Responsibilities: Design, manage, and execute frameworks for assessing internal and external signals to coordinate the drafting of bi-weekly intelligence briefs Research and draft briefings based on information gained from these frameworks Support the development of mechanisms to produce on-demand briefings for leadership Develop process improvements in relation to key team projects and initiatives Develop tools and metrics for measuring the efficacy of projects Help lead weekly meeting with Governance and Policy leaders identifying trends for bi-weekly briefs Minimum Qualifications: B.A. or B.S. degree Experience in program management and project planning 9+ years experience with strategic execution, marketing, communication and/or project management Demonstrated experience working in a fast-paced environment Preferred Qualifications: Experience with drafting reports, briefs, policy papers, or other materials for leadership Experience in collaboration between law, policy, intelligence or political science and technology Communication skills Experience working directly with senior executives and stakeholders Strategic thinker, self-starter, intellectually curious and creative individual with experience operating in ambiguity J.D., LLM, LLB or other advanced degree Effective at negotiating with and influencing stakeholders and colleagues to achieve optimal results and outcomes Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We are seeking Graphics Professionals for Meta and Meta Reality Labs. Our teams are defining the Graphics experience for hundreds of millions of users across the Meta family of apps including Instagram, Messenger and Facebook as well as devices such as Oculus, Portal and exciting upcoming wearables.Within Meta Reality Labs, we are developing the future of AR/VR by bringing products to consumers that transform entertainment and social experiences. The potential of AR/VR to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Advancements in Graphics play a key role here in replicating the real world in AR/VR. Additionally, we also have a few Graphics opportunities outside of Meta Reality Labs working on exciting Graphics applications as well.We have a variety of roles across different levels that span across real-time and offline rendering, pipeline and tools engineering, and graphics GPU driver and architecture. Depending on the team, the responsibilities will include the following. Graphics Software Engineer - GPU Driver Responsibilities: Develop innovative graphics frameworks, algorithms, and tools to maximize graphics quality and performance Partner closely with various infra and product teams across Meta, on camera, graphics, upcoming hardware, media enhancements, and more to create real-time rendering architecture Building tools and pipelines for generating very realistic synthetic images Enable high fidelity experiences through remote compute solutions on smaller devices with limited battery Building rendering subsystems for platforms such as Spark AR and Horizon Build a platform for cloud streamed games Document and support graphics features Write high-quality, performant, and maintainable code Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to deliver innovation into AR/VR products Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years of graphics software engineering experience or 3+ years of graphics software engineering experience with PhD 5+ years of experience with C/C++ programming Problem-solving and communication skills 5+ years of object-oriented and component based-design experience Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience Preferred Qualifications: Experience with either DirectX/Vulkan/OpenGL/Metal Experience implementing 3D graphics features such as lighting, effects, shaders and other low-level systems Experience delivering AAA Games, working on Graphics subsystems or the Game Engine AR/VR experience Experience with tools such as Maya, Houdini, Blender, 3Ds Max, Arnold, RenderMan, or Cycles Knowledge of ray tracing, rasterization and linear algebra Experience with low level performance profiling and optimization Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
