The potential of AR/VR to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Advancements in Graphics play a key role here in replicating the real world in AR/VR. Additionally, we also have a few Graphics opportunities outside of Meta Reality Labs working on exciting Graphics applications as well.We have a variety of roles across different levels that span across real-time and offline rendering, pipeline and tools engineering, and graphics GPU driver and architecture. Depending on the team, the responsibilities will include the following. Graphics Software Engineer - Pipeline and Tooling Responsibilities: Develop innovative graphics frameworks, algorithms, and tools to maximize graphics quality and performance Partner closely with various infra and product teams across Meta, on camera, graphics, upcoming hardware, media enhancements, and more to create real-time rendering architecture Building tools and pipelines for generating very realistic synthetic images Enable high fidelity experiences through remote compute solutions on smaller devices with limited battery Building rendering subsystems for platforms such as Spark AR and Horizon Build a platform for cloud streamed games Document and support graphics features Write high-quality, performant, and maintainable code Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to deliver innovation into AR/VR products Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years of experience with C/C++ programming 5+ years of graphics software engineering experience or 3+ years of graphics software engineering experience with PhD Problem-solving and communication skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience 5+ years of object-oriented and component-based design experience Preferred Qualifications: Experience with either DirectX/Vulkan/OpenGL/Metal Experience with low level performance profiling and optimization Experience delivering AAA Games, working on Graphics subsystems or the Game Engine AR/VR experience Experience implementing 3D graphics features such as lighting, effects, shaders and other low-level systems Experience with tools such as Maya, Houdini, Blender, 3Ds Max, Arnold, RenderMan, or Cycles Knowledge of ray tracing, rasterization and linear algebra Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

The Contingent Workforce team is a critical part of Meta’s People@ organization and critical to supporting Meta’s business teams’ ability to respond and pivot quickly to meet business needs. The Contingent Workforce leader is both a strong leader and change agent responsible for a team that partners across Meta to proactively support Contingent Worker needs, oversee the compliant Contingent Workforce program including our MSP/VMS relationships, and partner with internal stakeholders on policy, budgeting, forecasting/reporting, supplier management, sourcing, and escalations. The ideal candidate is someone who can collaboratively evolve our Contingent Workforce strategy with passion and deep acumen for process excellence and change management. Head of Contingent Workforce Management Responsibilities: Build and lead a high-performing global team, showing care, investing in their development, and holding them accountable for measurable impact in the NA, EMEA and ROW. Lead a global Contingent Workforce team to ensure the organization, process, and model proactively evolves to meet emergent business needs through the implementation of technology-driven solutions. Develop and manage strong governance and operational rigor to ensure visibility needed to inform business direction and investment. Exercise sound and practical judgment in the oversight of end-to-end operational processes for sourcing, interviewing, contracting, onboarding, and monitoring of contingent workers and vendor partners through our MSP model and SOW engagements. Establish, communicate, and implement a strategic vision and plan for the Contingent Workforce team world-wide. Manage the Contingent Workforce function by balancing strong execution on day-to-day responsibilities with the long-term People Operations roadmap. Partner with cross-functional partners and stakeholders to develop and drive a closed feedback loop to reduce manual touchpoints, eliminate people-intensive solutions, and ensure continuous improvement. Develop and scale service delivery metrics, KPIs, and SLAs and ensure teams are staffed to meet SLAs as the organization scales. Develop and maintain annual OpEx and HC staffing plans in partnership with People Ops Finance. Design and implement engagement models, workflows, and reporting to enable industry leading service delivery to hiring managers across Meta’s various business groups. Engage with business stakeholders to support their people resource needs and partner to determine appropriate use of FTE, Contractors, SOW, and BPO solutions. Partner with internal cross-functional partners to develop and manage a global value proposition, including standards, pay, and benefits for our diverse contingent workforce’s needs consistent with Meta’s mission and values while developing a proactive communications plan to support it. Partner with internal cross-functional partners and business leaders to ensure the Third Party support model suits Meta business needs and includes location strategy, contingency planning, and is audit ready. Ensure Third-Party service models include optimization, SLA and staffing incentives, weekly performance tracking, efficiency reporting, and QBRs and are in line with People Operations service delivery goals. Develop and maintain a process to review and revise contingent worker content for employee support and team-facing process/procedures/content to ensure it remains current. Understand business vision and proactively determine strategies to support the business achieving their goals. Lead Meta’s response to internal questions and external media enquiries, escalations, and manage responses to questions relating to our overall CW program. Minimum Qualifications: 12+ years experience in leading Contingent Workforce, Managed Service Provider (MSP), Operations or client leadership, Professional Services Category Management/Sourcing, or Recruiting Operations. 12+ years of work experience, including hands-on management and proven track record of thinking strategically, executing tactically, and managing through change. 12+ years experience in the engagement processes (sourcing, contracting, onboarding, escalation management) for temp workers, contractors, consultants, outsourced workers, and other SOW workers. Experience with Vendor Management Systems offerings, such as Wand, Fieldglass, Beeline. Experience with Managed Service Provider offerings and/or outsourced services procurement. Proven experience in managing people and building global teams. Experience managing multiple programs, developing robust operations, driving decisions in ambiguity under time pressure, and shifting priorities while maintaining organization and control. Proven high level of maturity, executive presence, and judgment in complex, high-profile situations. Experience working cross-functionally with all levels of management, both internally and externally. Proven consensus building skills with the “roll-up the sleeves” type of collaboration with stakeholders across a diverse, global team. Experience communicating and influencing decisions at the senior leadership executive level. Experience driving strategy and end-to-end implementation of projects from concept to completion, while maintaining confidentiality and discretion. Experience challenging the status quo to develop highly efficient and operational workflows and engagement models. Experience in managing Internal and External Audit Reviews. Proven experience working with Employment Legal across multiple markets to ensure compliance with employment regulations. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced Degree or MBA 5+ years base level experience, directly or indirectly, with international labor laws Certified Contingent Workforce Professional (CCWP) Lean or Six Sigma experience Experience working with or in support of diverse communities or working in companies with a global customer/user base Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

We are seeking an experienced leader to lead a global team that is responsible for delivering business services, including Business and Operations Program Management, Information and Knowledge Management, Technical Documentation, RFP and vendor related services, and developing new services. This leader will be responsible for defining and delivering highly scalable, reliable, leading-edge services and solutions that keep Infrastructure’s Data Center Teams nimble and one step ahead. This person will be an inspirational leader that can gain the support of stakeholders, teams and workstream owners. As a leader, the ideal candidate will be comfortable wearing multiple hats and provide coherent direction and inspiration to the entire team. The leader required for this role will have a demonstrated track record of being an innovative, intellectually curious problem solver capable of directing, coaching and mentoring teams to accomplish the impossible. This person should be able to drive the conversation toward a solution by including the right people, process, and technology. IBIZ OPM Leader/Director Responsibilities: Develop and execute a strategy allowing the organization to scale and improve its operations to support Meta’s Infra Data Center Group’s growth. Build and lead an organization with stakeholder focus, taking service delivery and operations to the next level of industry leadership. Understand, collaborate and influence across functional organizations. Forge partnerships across Meta Infra to ensure all organizations are aligned. Build high performing teams which includes mentoring and developing managers and individual contributors as well as hiring top talent. Build and lead a world-class team providing business services, including Business and Operations Program Management, Information and Knowledge Management, Technical Documentation, RFP and vendor related services, and developing new services capable of scaling with Meta through continued high growth. Lead and influence engineering and operations programs and teams, influencing system architecture and design to meet Infra Data Center Group’s business requirements. Understand the requirements of upstream and downstream stakeholders and collaborate with them to produce end-to-end scalable solutions. Lead automation and operationalization efforts, improving tooling and operational processes. Understand implications of process and tooling changes. Approximately 10-15% travel required. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, MIS, Computer Engineering or a related discipline. 15+ years of leadership, business plus technical program management or Data Center management experience. Understanding of production environments, systems, and operational dependencies. Experience with scale, with emphasis on Reliability, Efficiency, and Scalability. Experience in working with and/or leading engineering and operations functions. Thought leader within the organization, someone with experience to help advance internal solution strategy globally and challenge others in the organization to change. Appreciation for the Customer/Stakeholder. Proven experience to think Customer/Stakeholder-first, successful track record in building strategies and solutions to meet Customer/Stakeholder needs. Proven organizational, communication, interpersonal, relationship building skills conducive to collaboration, experience to work well in a cross-functional, matrix management environment consisting of operations, infrastructure and engineering teams. Experience thriving in a dynamic, fast-paced, environment where you must take on multiple responsibilities and do what it takes to get things done. Experience in development of a management team, personnel management, and staffing. Experience successfully leading complicated projects and programs, experience moving programs from concept to completion. Knowledge in program management methodologies. Experience in building services and service delivery. Understanding of implications of process and tooling (automation/systems) as well as organizational changes. Preferred Qualifications: Track record of successfully implementing and managing infrastructure programs (think data centers, capacity, networking, hardware, and software). Experience in a professional services firm, developing and delivering customer solutions. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. jobTitle: Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager
jobDescription: ISOS (Infrastructure Services & Operations Support) is a central organization of technical program managers that supports multiple data center and engineering teams that build and operate Facebook's private cloud infrastructure, which is one of the largest cloud systems in the world. We support product development across a variety of areas such as infrastructure capacity demand & supply management, data center maintenance, server & network repair, construction project controls, power management etc.We are looking for a Program Manager with strong skills and experience in technical program management, system design, process & workflow definition and managing cross-functional organizations. The Program Manager is expected to be analytical, detail-oriented, an effective communicator with the ability to go deep into learning their team’s systems and leverage their technical knowledge to influence and drive cross-team projects and roadmaps. You are also expected to work with engineering teams to define product roadmap, metrics, project plan and drive rapid development to build world class automation to help scale Facebook's infrastructure. Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager Responsibilities: Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases. Manage cross-functional programs in a matrix organization covering a range of areas. Articulate the technology, requirements, goals, and milestones for your program. Lead and prioritize strategic initiatives while working closely with teams across the organization, including partner teams around the world. Tackle complex problems with a strategic mindset and create programs for solving those problems. Proactively identify upcoming risks, inefficiencies, issues, and bottlenecks, and resolve cross-team issues. Define and own metrics and key performance indicators. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a directly related field, or equivalent practical experience. 10+ years of technical program management experience. Experience understanding business needs, translating them into product requirements and creating execution plans. Experience working on sophisticated technical systems and collaborating with engineers on system design. Experience leading cross-organizational programs, effectively influencing partners and holding them accountable to goals, timelines and deliverables. Analytical and problem solving experience including experience defining and collecting key metrics across projects. Experience communicating effectively across the organization with interpersonal skills, including relationship building and collaboration within a cross-functional team. Preferred Qualifications: Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline. Software development, infrastructure engineering, or coding experience. Knowledge of compute, storage and networking technologies. Knowledge of Data Center operations. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. jobTitle: Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager (Emerging Tech & Tooling)
jobDescription: Infrastructure Services Operational Support (ISOS) is an organization of technical program managers focused on Meta’s data center and remote infrastructure. We collaborate with Meta teams to operationalize new technologies, processes, and innovative automation to operate at a global scale.The ideal candidate thrives in a bottom-up environment where you collaboratively define direction and priorities, embrace the challenge of solving complex and ambiguous problems, and can apply the right amount of structure to enable teams to focus on the most impactful work. Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager (Emerging Tech & Tooling) Responsibilities: Define, build and lead cross-functional programs to deliver end-to-end solutions which solve various problems in technical and business domains. Accountable for identifying and overcoming end-to-end, cross-functional problems in technical domains across client and/or server infrastructure. Lead execution and delivery of solutions to resolve business problems via strategic thinking and on-the-ground leadership. Drive and influence technical and product strategy, proactively identify problems, align on priorities, and set direction for a broadly cross-functional area. Responsible for defining and delivering on technical requirements that solve people or product problems, platform or infra requirements in conjunction with partners. Define and own what success looks like, metrics & measurement, rollout, and scalable and sustainable operational plan. Build strong, trusting partnerships to readily mobilize people and influence across a broad range of partners, leaders, and organizations. Identify and improve inefficiencies in how we operate to move faster with higher quality outcomes. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, or equivalent practical experience. 6+ years of technical product/program management experience. 5+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or hardware engineering experience. Experience evaluating, defining, and improving end-to-end processes with functional and/or technical solutions. Experience working across organizations to drive business decisions with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Technical experience in planning, deploying, or operation of cloud infrastructure technology. Analytical, ambiguous problem-solving, and negotiation experience. Demonstrated track record of delivering business value using technology solutions in high-tech operations or engineering spaces. Preferred Qualifications: PMP or similar certifications. 10+ years of technical product/program management experience. Data Center experience or knowledge. Experience scaling and connecting programs in a dynamic environment. Hands-on engineering experience in hardware, systems, software, data/analytics, machine learning or related field. jobTitle: Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager, ERAD Tooling
jobDescription: Meta is seeking a forward thinking Infrastructure Data Center Technical Program Manager to join our Infrastructure Data Centers Site Services team. Our data centers, and the tens of thousands of servers installed in them, are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Meta is at the leading edge of the global data center industry both in terms of how data centers are designed and operated. This person should enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where adaptability and flexibility will be key to their success.The Infra Data Center Business Support team leverages operational efficiencies to develop effective solutions that support all aspects of data center operations. A critical pillar of the ERAD team’s role is the adherence to and continuous improvement of our ERAD (data “ERADication”) function, which designs, develops and deploys sanitization and destruction solutions and policy relating to storage media across the fleet. This role will work to develop/advance industry leading vision and strategy and help scale operations through partnership with cross functional teams to enable Meta’s growth. Infra Data Center Technical Program Manager, ERAD Tooling Responsibilities: Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases. Manage cross-functional programs in a matrix organization covering a range of areas. Articulate the technology, requirements, goals, and milestones for your program. Lead and prioritize strategic initiatives while working closely with teams across the organization, including partner teams around the world. Tackle complex problems with a strategic mindset and create programs for solving those problems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and vendors to scale operations through automation, process, and systems/tooling enhancements. Proactively identify upcoming risks, inefficiencies, issues, and bottlenecks, and resolve cross-team issues. Review operational compliance issues and determine if a technology solution is required or a process correction needs to be made. Define and own metrics and key performance indicators. 10-20% domestic and international travel required. Minimum Qualifications: Proven experience executing on multiple tasks simultaneously. Analytical, problem-solving, negotiation and organizational skills with knowledge to focus under pressure. Interpersonal skills, including relationship building and “roll-up the sleeves” type of collaboration within a diverse, global, cross-functional team. Resourceful, action-orientated with experience getting things done and overcoming obstacles. Experience working in ambiguous situations and environments. 8+ years project/program management with demonstrated experience in self-managing complex program delivery in a fast-paced, matrix environment. Business analyst background with experience in requirement analysis techniques/methodologies. Track record of adapting, learning new skill sets, and gaining an understanding of operational challenges. Organizational and time management skills. Communication skills and demonstrate attention to detail. Understanding of large scale environments and/or how to scale. Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), related field, or equivalent practical experience. Preferred Qualifications: Demonstrated track record of delivering business value using technology solutions in high-tech operations space. Familiarity with regulatory and compliance frameworks relevant to technology and social media. Data center, hardware, and/or server infrastructure experience. Our organization provides logistics and supply chain services to Meta's global Data Center network. The team is looking for an experienced candidate to lead transformational supply chain initiatives that solve complex problems in the areas of planning, receiving, inventory management, storage, distribution and reverse logistics. The expert will engage with an experienced cross-functional team to drive change and implement standard processes and tooling solutions across the portfolio, as well as develop and monitor KPIs and metrics to track health of these programs. The ideal candidate will be a thought leader, drive consensus, have a strong business acumen and have a history of scaling supply chain organizations. Infrastructure Materials Manager Responsibilities: Lead programs that are ambiguous in scope where you will collaborate across infrastructure teams to align on vision, design and implement innovative technical solutions. Manage cross-functional program teams to lead the ideation, development and launch of technologies & processes to support the global multi-echelon data center supply chain and logistics. Use Solution Architect principles to design highly effective and scalable solutions to satisfy business outcomes and requirements. Ensure that solutions are fit for purpose, secure, scalable, flexible, future proofed. Collaborate closely with partner teams such as hardware engineering, sourcing, finance, datacenter operations, data science, compliance, etc. to align on a cross-functional roadmap, define goals, leverage knowledge, other solutions, and best practice. Gather and prioritize multiple stakeholders’ requirements to build, maintain, and implement scalable roadmaps. Stay current and fluent with leading supply chain product offerings and common and emerging data solutions in use across the industry continuously learning new technologies and processes and introducing these into the organization. Lead initiatives that build team strength and resiliency, mentor, support team growth and the recruiting process. Minimum Qualifications: 15+ years experience in an operations environment as a Supply Chain/Operations Professional, Business Strategy & Planning, Consultant, Product Manager, or related occupation. Analytical skills and experience in gathering and analyzing data/information to address complex problems. Bachelor's in Engineering, Business Administration, Mathematics, Supply Chain Management or related field, or equivalent experience. Experience synthesizing complex problems into bite sized chunks and translate the afore-mentioned problem to an org level solution and align on implementation. Technical and significant Supply Chain expertise, and leadership in a matrixed environment of internal and external partners, and suppliers. Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, or Science. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is looking for an experienced Infrastructure Materials Manager to support the service of physical infrastructure. The team is responsible for logistics support and material planning for various technical teams that operate physical infrastructure. The Infrastructure Materials Manager will build strong partnerships with various internal business partners, plan material inventory, manage material escalation & coordinate execution activities, enable automated processes by ensuring the necessary inputs and initial setup to enable operation efficiency in the growing business area. This position is for an operations professional who can be flexible and operate complex programs, maintain engagement with multiple stakeholders, envision the future systems & processes, and lead cross-functional efforts to support ever changing and growing customer needs. Infrastructure Materials Manager Responsibilities: Support Materials Management team in determining optimal supply chain execution for all products by providing analyses based on demand, failure rates, decommissions, EOL/LTB, cost, etc. Engage with internal customers and gain understanding of their current and future needs. Shape the customer-facing vision of the team and roadmap internal activities in support of the vision. Plan material for consumption at globally distributed locations. Consolidate or generate material forecasts based on data and cross-functional inputs. Act as the primary liaison between OEM/Vendors/Distributors and Meta managing, monitoring and driving spare materials requirements. Understand the underlying factors behind material demand through data analysis and cross-functional collaboration. Sense changes to demand and adjust proactively. Formalize and standardize data analysis & coordination across IBOS, which includes, planning, fulfillment, finance & transportation, to mitigate and manage risk. Possess in-depth understanding of systems and tools. Identify gaps, troubleshoot, and provide inputs for future system development. Create materials management focused executive dashboards and KPI metrics for operations all hands meetings (Tier I and Tier II metrics). Determine optimal supply chain execution through detailed analyses. Flexible & Collaborate with adjacent teams on sourcing, quality, and production issues. Work with vendors, manufacturers, and sourcing teams on tactical and strategic items. Minimum Qualifications: BS degree in engineering, science, or business, or related work experience 8+ years of supply chain experience Experience on inventory management, forecasting methods, NPI and service operations Working knowledge of Supply Chain planning tools and ERP systems Experience in program management, vendor and stakeholder management Proven communication, problem solving, and interpersonal experience Advanced user of Excel, VBA, or similar data visualization tool Experience in process mapping, gap analysis, and requirement elicitation Experience working in cross-functional projects across multiple teams Preferred Qualifications: Graduate degree in management, operations or supply chain 5+ years of Excel, Tableau, quantitative modeling or related experience In-depth understanding of systems and tools Experience in logistics operations in a global high growth environment Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. At Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) our mission is to give people the tools to feel connected anytime, anywhere. We create new, category-defining consumer hardware and software - such as Oculus Quest, Portal, and Spark AR - that are immersive, social, and increase the depth of people's connections. Our team is a diverse group of problem solvers, inventors, and proven visionaries who are relentless about transforming everyday occurrences into rich experiences that have the potential to improve the way billions of people live. We're seeking experienced Infrastructure software engineers to join our teams in FRL. Join us! jobTitle: Internal Communications Director, Facilities, Culinary, and Security

management Support the local Data Center Operations team and other cross-functional departments as needed Promote and model an attitude of continuous improvement, partnership, and teamwork in behaviors and communications Promote and model an attitude of openness to giving, seeking, and receiving 360-degree feedback Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Meta is seeking an experienced Site Lead Construction Manager to join our Data Center Engineering & Construction Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating, and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability and capital conservation. The Design, Engineering and Construction (DEC) team thinks from chip to chiller (or electrical substation), determining configurations and ensuring maximum efficiency of our compute infrastructure, and the Infrastructure Delivery team is committed to continual optimization of the delivery process at each level. The Infrastructure Data Center organization and its sub teams operate in a matrix team structure and the Lead Construction Manager will have the responsibility for New Build projects, GC and trade partner relationships, team member development and relationship management with key cross functional operational partners (Facilities Operations, Site Operations) at the site in a culture of collaboration, safety and quality unparalleled in the data center construction industry. The Lead Construction Manager is responsible for large scale green field projects and will be part of a team of matrixed Safety, QA/QC and Project Controls (Cost + Schedule) professionals at site toward predictable outcomes. Lead Construction Manager Responsibilities: Report to Delivery Campus Manager, accountable for projects and the region success in: Safety, Quality, Schedule Milestones, Forecast Accuracy, GMP Accuracy. Responsible for the culture of partnership, teamwork, and growth at the campus. Responsible for the management of major external partner (General Contractor, Trade Partners, Consultants) relationships at the campus level. Responsible for the management of risk identification review process and provide reports (Safety, QA/QC, Financial, Schedule). Responsible for the management of CapEx budgets for the campus. Responsible for the management of warranty work program for existing data center buildings. Responsible to ensure proactive risk identification and mitigation for all new build projects at a data center campus as defined by predictability in: Safety, Quality, Schedule, & Cost. Responsible for the management of cross functional team for Owner Furnished Equipment (OFE) procurement and delivery process. Support the on-site team on the live environment retrofit projects and connectivity (fiber and network infrastructure) projects on campus. Support project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, trade partner and consultant scopes. Partner with cross functional teams for the development of annual capital project budgets including the provision of requested ROM construction cost estimates. Partner with cross functional teams to finalize project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, trade partner and consultant scopes. 10% travel to headquarters and other data center campuses. Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or equivalent construction experience. 15+ years of experience in construction management or equivalent experience. Proven successful experience with ground-up projects. Knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards. Highly skilled with negotiations, capital budget management, and contract management. Successful management of large construction teams inclusive of trade partner and/or general contractor management. Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of data center systems including mechanical, electrical, building management system and fire protection. Working knowledge of CPM scheduling methodologies and schedule management. Working knowledge of CapEx, and construction cost control strategies. Working knowledge of supply chain management including creative risk and mitigation strategies. Proven success in matrixed organization structures. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Meta is seeking an experienced Lead Construction Manager to join our Data Center Engineering & Construction Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating, and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability and capital conservation. Fiber connectivity) Experience delivering large scale construction management ($550M+ projects) or experience in hyperscale mission critical data centers from a lead construction management role Experience delivering complex technical infrastructure construction projects with heavy electrical and mechanical systems Experience delivering new greenfield, occupied space retrofit, and operational space retrofit construction projects Experience successfully managing contractors, vendors, and supplier relationships as a responsible steward, partner, and collaborator Working knowledge of electrical and mechanical systems Working knowledge of construction industry standards, building codes and safety standards. Meta is seeking an experienced Process Integration Logistics Process Engineer in support of logistic operations across Meta's Data Center infrastructure. This individual will be responsible for working closely with cross-functional program managers and Data Center leaders/partners to design, capture, and distribute standardized logistics process solutions for the global logistics footprint. You’ll be responsible for driving continuous process improvement, while remaining flexible to support the changing needs of the business. You will influence strategic priorities and brief global leaders on targeted process improvements resulting in efficient growth and development of the logistics team. This individual must work with partners across the Data Center ecosystem to implement measurable and flexible processes in support of the overall strategy. This is a highly impactful position and requires a strong operational knowledge of process design, supply chain industry knowledge, metrics development, safety and EHS oversight, and training and development program knowledge. Additionally, this role requires a creative approach to problem solving and willingness to accept ambiguity in their work environment. Meta needs a Logistics Process Engineer to create and define this role within our operation, not just replicate an industry experience. Logistics Process Engineer Responsibilities: Develop, refine, and maintain knowledge management repositories to promulgate safe and efficient data center logistics operations Manage version control within documentation and proactively scrutinize documentation to ensure the most up-to-date process documentation is in circulation Effectively communicate across numerous regions and cross-functional stakeholders to gather inputs for training and documentation rollout Proactively identify process gaps, engineer processes and distribute across data center regions Liaise and partner on behalf of data centers to headquarter teams to identify training documentation gaps and opportunities Partner with regional field leads and key cross functional stakeholders in implementing best-in-class logistics training programs Ability to travel up to 25% Minimum Qualifications: 4+ years of experience in learning and development programs within a logistics, retail operations, supply chain or related industry Working knowledge of ERP systems, WMS, TMS, MS office suite, and other supply chain tools Experience communicating effectively across the organization with interpersonal skills, including relationship building and collaboration within a cross-functional team Experienced in cross functional collaboration across multiple teams and experience working independently and part of a team Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business Management, Engineering, or Operations Research, or equivalent experience Experience dealing with ambiguity, operating in a high-growth environment, and solving problems with limited oversight Proven background and interest in process improvement and gap analysis Preferred Qualifications: Development of Supply Chain tools experience Experience working across multiple geographic regions Six Sigma or Lean Certification Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. This new role is being asked to bring people management skills, and an ability to drive program execution. With construction jobsites throughout NORAM, this role will be tasked with continuing the journey of our world class safety program. Loss Control Area Manager - NORAM Responsibilities: Manage a team of Geographical Loss Control Managers (3-6) to implement strategic initiatives, while empowering those managers to develop tactical execution and safety professional growth. Responsible for North America Loss Control team health in alignment with DEC and Meta values to ensure sustainable performance at scale. Establish and foster a high performing team. Mentor and develop future leaders through proactive feedback and intentional performance management. Interpret, synthesize, and communicate North America’s Safety performance to internal and external stakeholders. Educate and enforce Loss Control program standards and serve as point of escalation for NORAM Geographical Loss Control Managers. Collaborate with internal and external partners to identify areas of improvement, and accomplishments. Through this collaboration, they are responsible to effectively share lessons learned and develop optimized execution approaches. Interface at the Area manager peers and Geographical teams between design, construction, and facility operations leadership as well as the project/program teams to ensure embedment of the Loss Control vision and strategy. Provide strategic feedback and direction to internal/external program leaders and geographical staff on the Loss Control program regarding Meta’s expectations and requirements. Support partnership with Safety sponsors through proactive communication, strategic thinking, positive engagement, and offering subject matter expertise. Being able to effectively lead high performing teams by demonstrating managerial skillsets that are central to Meta’s management expectations. Functioning as a positive leader who empowers others and promotes the ability for others to succeed are central to being successful in this role. Able to adapt to a fast paced, hands-on, start-up work environment. Ability to travel to CA headquarters and other data center locations on a regular basis. Considerable Travel (up to 50%) within North America. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Safety/Occupational Health or equivalent technical degree and/or 10+ years direct professional experience in leading safety programs on large scale geographically spanned regions. 10+ years of field experience pertaining to large scale construction projects, functioning as a safety professional. 4+ years of experience in managing people managers that manage safety professionals. 5+ years of experience in developing, maturing, and implementing large scale safety programs. 5+ years of experience in mission critical environments, while leading teams and demonstrating an experience driving whole scale execution. Proven communication skills and the experience leading strategic improvement initiatives. Preferred Qualifications: Data center design and construction experience. Success in matrixed organization structures. Experience in building and cultivating high performance organizations. Experience working with a variety of safety systems. Demonstrated experience fostering team cultures that empower all team members and promote open dialog. BCSP Safety Certification. The Privacy Engineering organization ensures that Facebook is doing everything technically possible to protect people’s data while building great products. This team of mission-minded engineers is expert in the landscape of privacy risks and passionate about consulting across the company on implementing the proper safeguards and technical mitigations to ensure that our users’ privacy is honored across the Facebook family of apps. The Manager of Privacy Engineering (Technical Audit) will help lead the Privacy Engineering organization in following through on a multi-year privacy-first roadmap and help define what comes next in Privacy. He or she will act as the technical voice in all privacy decisions and discussions across the company. Manager, Privacy Engineering Responsibilities: Recruit, hire and mentor privacy engineers, of various levels of experience, into a high-performing team. Play a key role in driving code and architecture reviews as well as large cross-company privacy reviews of products and features. Work closely with Security and Privacy leaders to help define goals that are properly aligned to company-wide goals. Define and articulate a clear vision for privacy, and influence leaders across all of Facebook to adopt a balanced view of product and privacy goals in overall decision-making. Provide leadership in developing and delivering innovative solutions to help enforce privacy practices with consistency and efficiency, at scale. Work closely with technical and non-technical teams, including Engineering, Product and Legal. Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years of work experience in software engineering, privacy engineering or security engineering, including 3+ years of hands-on management of high-performing team of engineers and/or engineering managers. Experience building relationships and influencing stakeholders across multiple disciplines. Experience communicating highly technical concepts to non-technical audience. Code maintenance and review experience in one or more general purpose languages. BS in Computer Science or technical field of study, or equivalent industry experience. Preferred Qualifications: Experience running operational teams. Experience collaborating with compliance and policy teams, government entities, external privacy-focused community members and members of the press. Meta is seeking a data center Mechanical Subject Matter Expert to join our Data Center Facility Operations team. Our data centers serve as the foundation upon which our systems operate to meet the demands of our customers. The Mechanical Subject Matter Expert will be a part of the facility operations team and will be responsible for being the mechanical system technical operations expert. The candidate will need to have a broad understanding of mechanical system and equipment function and will be responsible for procedure-based mechanical maintenance, troubleshooting, repair, training, and project oversight. The Mechanical Subject Matter Expert will need to be experienced in diverse technologies such as chiller systems, evaporative cooling, DX cooling, water distribution and treatment, emergency diesel generators, fire suppression systems, and have a working knowledge of building automation systems and electrical distribution. Mechanical Subject Matter Expert Responsibilities: Serve as primary onsite technical resource as part of a team of mechanical infrastructure systems and equipment, with an emphasis on practical/field application Author or approve work procedures to cover mechanical troubleshooting, repair, retrofit, and maintenance activities, with an emphasis on assessing & mitigating personnel and system risk Conduct or oversee hands-on troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance of mechanical infrastructure systems and equipment Manage vendor relationships for mechanical system maintenance and retrofit work Provide Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QAQC) oversight of initial campus construction, retrofit projects & maintenance activity Lead and/or participate in root cause analysis activities in area of expertise, specifically mechanical infrastructure systems and equipment Oversight of water quality management program Provide training to Critical Facility Engineers and other cross functional teams on mechanical/fire & life safety/industrial water equipment/systems and procedures Provide feedback on global mechanical maintenance strategies and global mechanical system design improvements Other duties as required to support the operation of Facebook data centers Travel expectations: Can be significant during first 1-3 months for initial training/onboarding and then ongoing occasional travel for factory witness tests, collaboration, etc. Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or GED 7+ years relevant mechanical industry experience or mechanical trade level experience Bachelor’s degree in related field plus 3+ years relevant mechanical industry experience will be considered in lieu of 7+ years mechanical industry experience Experience interpreting blueprints/CAD drawings Significant experience in comprehending mechanical plans, specifications, and equipment shop drawings Working knowledge of psychrometric charts Working knowledge of critical facility operations with experience or understanding of procedure-based work Working knowledge of electrical, and life safety monitoring and control systems typically used in critical environments Experience working in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite - Word, Excel, and Outlook Preferred Qualifications: 7+ years’ experience in a data center or other critical environment Trade Certification or state license in Mechanical (HVAC) Equipment field service engineering experience Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is seeking an experienced Site Launch Lead Construction Manager to join our Datacenter Engineering & Construction Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability and capital conservation. The Datacenter Engineering and Construction (DEC) team thinks from chip to chiller (or electrical substation), determining configurations and ensuring maximum efficiency of our compute infrastructure, and the Delivery Construction team is committed to continual optimization of the delivery process at each level. The Infrastructure Data Center organization and its sub teams operate in a matrix team structure and the Site Launch Construction Manager will have the campus level responsibility for New Construction project launch success, GC and trade partner relationships, site culture, team member development and relationship management with key cross functional operational partners (Facilities Operations, Global Datacenter Connectivity, and Facilities Engineering to name a few) at the site in a culture of collaboration, safety and quality unparalleled in the datacenter construction industry. The Site Launch Construction Manager is responsible for $1Million- $1.5Billion project sizes managing a team of 2-3 direct reports and leading a team of matrixed Safety, QAQC and Project Controls (Cost + Schedule) professionals at site toward predictable outcomes. NA Site Launch Construction Manager Responsibilities: Report to Facebook Geographical Construction Manager, accountable for project and campus success in: Safety, Quality, Schedule Milestones, Forecast Accuracy, & GMP Accuracy Assume accountability for Delivery’s culture of partnership, teamwork and growth at the campus in the launch phase of a project Represent Delivery in the Circle of Leadership at each campus and partner effectively to become a high performing team Manage and develop onsite team of direct report Construction Managers (both Full Time Employees and Contingent Workers) and matrixed reports specializing in Safety, Quality, Project Controls (Cost & Schedule) Support project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, trade partner and consultant scopes Assist with providing capital project budgets and provide ROM construction cost estimates along with managing CapEx and OpEx budgets Manage cross functional team for Owner Furnished Equipment procurement and delivery process Manage biweekly risk identification review process and provide report (financial, schedule, Q/C) Manage Knowledge capture and transfer at the program and campus level Manage General Contractor relationship at the campus level to include GC personnel development and succession Manage initiatives focused on leveraging improved predictability or capacity from supply chain 75% travel to new campus locations Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering or similar degree 15+ years experience in construction and project planning Experience with ground-up construction and greenfield site development requirements Experience in construction management, capital budget management, and knowledge of electrical and mechanical systems Knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards including fire protection regulations Negotiation experience and experience providing solutions to complex problems under pressure Experience with MS Project, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications: Overall understanding of building systems including mechanical, electrical, building management system, and fire protection in a datacenter environment Knowledge of CPM scheduling methodologies and familiarity with Primavera P6 Datacenter development and construction experience Familiarity with retrofit projects in live data center or other mission critical buildings, including development of Methods of Procedure (MOPs) Procore software experience Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Facebook's Edge & Network Service (ENS) team is actively looking for passionate people to help us tackle the unique set of challenges and opportunities we face, while contributing to our company mission of connecting the world. Our team is the execution arm of the Facebook network team and is responsible for the deployment and support of all production networks (Edge, Backbone, Optical, and Datacenter) as well as our content delivery network (CDN) across the globe. This truly global team offers a unique career opportunity to work with all of the latest network technologies and talented engineers solving some of the most complex problems in the industry. Network Engineer, Deployment & Support Responsibilities: Deployment, configuration, and management of all network infrastructure on our datacenter campus Work with partner teams and vendors to manage day-to-day operations and reliability of the regional network Schedule and perform maintenance including upgrades, migrations, and decommissioning of production networks Create deployment packages and maintain as-built documentation and asset database for installed network gear Establish and implement global best practices and contribute to the design of new scalable network solutions Support the development, testing and integration of new hardware and software platforms into the network Participate in an on-call rotation to support the regional network infrastructure 24x7 10% of travel required, up to 30% based on projects Minimum Qualifications: Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. 4+ years of work experience responsible for designing, deploying and operating large-scale networks Experience configuring and troubleshooting routing and switching protocols (BGP, IS-IS, MPLS, RSVP-TE, VRRP) Working knowledge of network protocols (TCP/UDP, DHCP, DNS) and experience with IPv4 and IPv6 Experience working in a multi-vendor environment with hands-on experience with networking hardware Working knowledge of physical infrastructure design including structured cabling and fiber-optic cabling Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and deliver against mission critical deadlines Proven experience working in a global team environment and solving problems with limited supervision Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of 40/100G Ethernet and CWDM, DWDM and optical transport network technologies Experience with field-based work in Data Centers, Colocation Facilities, Internet Exchanges, or Central Offices Working knowledge of data center power and cooling infrastructure and critical facility operational best practices Familiarity with the Linux based systems and experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl) Technical leadership capabilities and people management experience Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta's Edge & Network Service (ENS) team is actively looking for passionate people to help us tackle the unique set of challenges and opportunities we face, while contributing to our company mission of connecting the world. Our team is the execution arm of the Meta network team and is responsible for the deployment and support of all production networks (Edge, Backbone, Optical, and Datacenter) as well as our content delivery network (CDN) across the globe. This global team offers a unique career opportunity to work with talent engineers on all of the latest network technologies solving some of the most complex problems in the industry. Network Engineer, Operations Support Responsibilities: Maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair functions of network infrastructure on our datacenter campus in adherence to SLAs. Work with partner teams and vendors to manage day-to-day operations and reliability of the network within assigned geographic region. Manage project timelines to support turn-up within expected completion intervals. Proactively contribute to support documentation, automation and processes as they evolve. Use internal tools and scripts to configure, monitor, and repair services. Create and collaborate on MOPs, processes, as-built documentation and asset database for installed network infrastructure and structured cabling. Support the installation and provisioning of data center equipment, servers and racks. Management of vendor relationships, work scheduling and forecasting. Metric management at the site level to meet SLA targets for installation and repair. Participate in an on-call rotation to support the network infrastructure 24x7. 25% of travel required, up to 50% based on projects. Minimum Qualifications: Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and deliver against mission critical deadlines. Experience working in a multi-vendor environment with hands-on experience with network hardware, structured cable, and fiber infrastructure. Oversee the vendor intake and workflow necessary to facilitate the delivery of ticketed work requests. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Working knowledge of internet networking technologies (TCP/IP, routing, switching) and optical transport technologies. Working knowledge of 40/100G Ethernet and CWDM, DWDM, and optical transport network technologies. Working knowledge across partner teams to accept new build and retrofit spaces from delivery to production. Technical knowledge of routers, switches, routing protocols, and circuit field activities. 4+ years of work experience responsible for installation, maintenance, and operating large-scale networks or servers. Working knowledge of physical infrastructure design including cable management, low voltage installations, and rack installation. Experience with field-based work in Data Centers, Colocation Facilities, Internet Exchanges, or Central Offices. Preferred Qualifications: Working knowledge of data center power and cooling infrastructure and critical facility operational best practices. Experience configuring and troubleshooting routing and switching protocols (BGP, IS-IS, MPLS, RSVP-TE, VRRP). Familiarity with the Linux-based systems and experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl). Knowledge in technical leadership capabilities and people management. jobTitle: Network Infrastructure Engineer, Global Design and Construction
jobDescription: Meta's Edge & Network Service (ENS) team is actively looking for passionate people to help us tackle the unique set of challenges and opportunities we face, while contributing to our company mission of connecting the world. of data center and network designs to ensure seamless integration of new infrastructure and enable scalability Maintain technical reference, process, and training documentation Influence development direction, and executing tactically 10+ years of work experience with designing and deploying large-scale data center network infrastructure Knowledge of data center power and cooling infrastructure design Preferred Qualifications: Expert knowledge of inside/outside plant cable design and dark fiber builds Knowledge of data center infrastructure management (DCIM) and physical security systems Data center design or relevant telecommunications certifications Familiarity with the Linux based systems and experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl) Experience working on a teams Knowledge of data center power path including design and installation best practices and industry standards Experience working with on-site construction teams and managing contractor and vendor jobTitle: Network Infrastructure Engineer, Global Design and Construction

Facebook's Privacy Review Program team is looking for a Privacy Review Operations Manager to support the Privacy Review program with a goal of managing ongoing compliance, assessment and program upkeep. This is a high impact role within Meta’s privacy organization that will have visibility across the organization. In this role, you'll work with product and privacy program managers to monitor, assess and maintain and uphold privacy program expectations. You will ensure that our program functions as intended and is updated when needed to keep up with industry changes. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates to deliver our innovative products. The Data Center Business Operations team is seeking a technically minded Manager to support the Operational Expense program. In this role, you will be expected to help drive process automation and standardization, create analytical models and dashboards, develop best practices for data aggregation, and partner with Finance and cross-functional teams to support the organization in executing against its priorities. You will play a key role in the analysis and reporting of operational costs by using analytical rigor to drive insight, alignment, and identify opportunities. You will be expected to think critically about Facebook’s Data Center infrastructure and process complex data sets and workflows into actionable strategies. Operations Strategy Manager Responsibilities: Support and evolve the global data center expense program through driving process improvements and automation efficiencies around planning, reporting, and ongoing communications to key stakeholders Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to help inform key business decisions about the growth of the data center organization Drive rigor and visibility around key business drivers, metrics and progress of data center initiatives through development of data architecture, dashboards and visualizations Convey a data-driven story to technical and non-technical audiences around key business insights, in collaboration with Finance and other cross-functional partners Minimum Qualifications: Experience managing multiple projects and coordinating with internal team and external partners, leadership, and other stakeholders Experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, and defining recommended actions MBA or MS in a related field (e.g., Engineering, Economics, Statistics, or similar discipline) Experience with SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau), including using advanced functionality (e.g. data blending) 8+ years of experience in business strategy or managing costs in technology infrastructure Preferred Qualifications: Experience operating independently and shifting priorities quickly, while maintaining a high degree of organization and control Experience turning complex and ambiguous problem statements into structured solutions while working in a highly cross-functional environment Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Meta is looking for an analytical thinker with experience in policy, government, business operations, or law to join our Organic Content Policy team. The team’s mission is to create and communicate rules for our products that empower expression and foster a safe environment for people on Meta’s family of apps. As an Organic Content Policy team member, you will work closely with a number of other teams at Facebook and Instagram, including our Global Community Operations, Product, Legal, Communications, and Public Policy teams. You will play a key role in developing, applying, and communicating our Community Standards both internally and externally. You will also manage high-profile content escalations. At times, you will be expected to make difficult decisions, under pressure, about whether to allow or remove content. Many of these decisions will garner attention in the media and be the subject of intense debate in civil society and governments around the globe. The ideal candidate will be an execution-minded professional who can think strategically, adapt quickly, work independently, and rapidly earn credibility and trust within all levels of the organization. They will be able to critically analyze and communicate the costs and benefits of refinements to policies and their implementation, and to manage multiple internal stakeholders while balancing differing opinions and perspectives and weighing risk in order to provide effective policy advice to leadership. They should be passionate about the services we provide and the people that we serve. Given the demands of content-related escalations, the candidate will sometimes be expected to work irregular hours, including early mornings, late nights, or weekends. Organic Content Policy, Manager Responsibilities: Craft and implement content policies that take into consideration the needs of a global community Act as a global escalation point of contact for high-priority escalations and manage internal policy analysis and communications for policy issues Help articulate policy philosophy, launches, and changes to relevant parties, including management, operations, and other internal and external stakeholders Build relationships with and understand the perspectives of partners on internal teams, such as Public Policy, Communications, Operations, Product, and Legal and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to drive policy improvements Minimum Qualifications: 6+ years experience in policy, government, project management, law, risk management, crisis communications, or operations Bachelor's degree in liberal arts/humanities or related discipline Effective at consensus-building, and communicating cross-functionally with internal audiences Experience articulating complex issues clearly via multiple mediums, in a multi-tasking and fast paced environment Demonstrated analytical-thinking and problem-solving experience Preferred Qualifications: Experience in Policy Development, Trust & Safety, Strategic Response, or Crisis Management Experience managing and supporting a diverse team Experience driving and managing multiple projects simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment Experience framing and briefing difficult decisions to senior leadership Experience working at pace to make difficult decisions under pressure, use critical thinking skills, have strong drafting communications, and demonstrate strong leadership and interpersonal skills to organize and build relationships with teams across the company Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Facebook is seeking a Postdoctoral Researcher to join Facebook AI Research, a research organization focused on making fundamental progress in AI. Facebook AI Research (FAIR) conducts cutting-edge research to deepen our understanding of existing AI methods and advance the state-of-the-art. For this position, the applicant will engage with the supervisor and other researchers in Facebook AI Research (FAIR) to develop and implement research agenda, publish world-class research works, and make external impact. You will apply high standards to the research and develop an ability to identify highly impactful projects in a complex and unexplored domain. You will be able to gain valuable experience in a top-tier research institute, publish academic papers on a regular basis, and build your reputation across the world. Postdoc research areas may include Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Speech & Audio, Conversational AI, Theory, Reinforcement Learning, Robotics, Graphics, Human & Machine Intelligence, or other similar fields. Postdoc positions are one year fixed-term positions, and we have opportunities across several regions. We will interview during the following hiring windows in 2022. Candidates are welcome to apply at any time, but may not hear back if their application is received outside of these timeframes:March 18, 2022 - April 29, 2022 June 20, 2022 - July 22, 2022September 18, 2022 - October 14, 2022 Postdoctoral Researcher, Artificial Intelligence (PhD) Responsibilities: Perform research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines. Collaborate with your supervisor and other researchers to discuss, develop and implement research agenda. Write and debug high-quality research code and research papers. Design and implement experiments to test research ideas on a variety of problems. High quality papers and present research at conferences. Minimum Qualifications: Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a PhD degree or completing a postdoctoral assignment in Computer Science or a similar field. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta. Research background in Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Speech, Robotics, Graphics, or similar field. Experience solving analytical problems using analytic and quantitative approaches. Experience communicating research. Experience coding in C/C++, Python, C#, or other similar language. Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. Preferred Qualifications: First-authored publications at peer-reviewed conferences (ICML, ICLR, NeurIPS, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, SIGGRAPH, CoRL, ICASSP, INTERSPEECH, ACL, NAACL, EMNLP, or similar). Research and engineering experience demonstrated via grants, fellowships, patents, internships, work experience, and/or coding competitions. Experience solving complex problems and comparing alternative solutions, trade-offs, and diverse points of view to determine a path forward. Experience communicating research for public audiences of peers. Experience working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment. Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Our data centers are the foundation upon which our software operates with efficient ease. Building and operating technical infrastructure the "right" way from the day they go live is synonymous with ensuring capacity availability and capital conservatism. Architecting, constructing, operating and continually innovating the telecommunications and structured cabling infrastructure within our data centers is fundamental to ensuring high availability, the capacity to meet our extreme growth demands and obtaining the most robust and cost effective online service in the world! The successful candidate will provide a technical perspective along with operational guidance to the partner team throughout organization and will assist the Retrofits construction team in successfully launching new programs and projects. The responsibilities of this role include coordinating and prioritizing a wide range of projects and processes within the site as well as communicating issues and successes with respective operations groups. This position is full-time. The project locations will be spread across the United States and the world. Managing stakeholders located across all regions and time zones is a significant challenge and is key to the success of our projects. Preconstruction Manager, Leased Data Centers Responsibilities: Maintain deep knowledge of the Lease/Colo market and support site selection team in developing strategic partnership with the Landlord firms Manage multiple simultaneous Lease Data Center (DC) pre-construction phase at strategic and project level from inception through hand over to the construction teams Provide input into development, review and iteration of Basis of Design (BOD) for various Lease Product Types In coordination with stakeholders, lead development and management of project scope, schedule, budget, quality requirements, proactive risk identification and mitigation, etc. for Lease DC projects in alignment with the BOD Tightly manage design and scope development from inception through IFC and managing scope change effectively Manage ambiguity of project parameters and changing project limitations Work in conjunction with the team’s Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to understand the cost, quality and schedule impacts of new designs, materials and construction methods Strategic planning including detailed build requirements, project coordination and scheduling, suggested vendor selection, allocation model and procurement to maintain synergy with the Green Field program Frequently interface with construction managers, technical program managers, cost estimators, schedulers, capacity planning teams, operations, site teams and multi-disciplinary engineering partners to manage projects through the pre-construction phase. Keeping partners and stakeholders informed and accountable Ensure internal processes are followed and align expectations early on delivery timelines Develop preliminary schedules and cost estimates with high level resource planning and stakeholder coordination Lead regular status updates meetings to share current status with others and keep management well informed of changes to the project timeline as it develops Support leadership with forecasting and budget efforts as required Share current project status with upstream and downstream partners, ensuring crisp and complete hand-offs between teams Represent the lease program at a deep level throughout the org, to be able to build the appropriate communication channels both within and outside the team Partner across diverse pillars to set goals, direction, and strategy to support a portfolio of leased data centers Resolve conflicts (both technical and interpersonal) to ensure the project teams have paths toward resolution Mentor
